Title: Saved by last minute booking

Title: Hotel was beautiful and food was lovely, Staff where fantastic, amazing Hotel.

Review:
This is such a fantastic hotel. We parked in the adjacent car park. Got the lift straight to hotel lobby. As it was raining this was a godsend. 
On check in the staff were very friendly and gave us a voucher for 2 drinks as it was my husbands birthday. 
Our room was clean and very comfortable .
The food in the restaurant and at breakfast was of fantastic quality and still a great variety given the current restrictions.
We had treatments in the hotel spa. All I can say is wow well worth the money. 
Overall I loved our stay and will definitely be back.
Title: Fantastic hotel

Review: The suite we had was amazing, I truly recommend the royal mile suite for that sexual healing - feeling  and of course the memorable wet sticky moments. The bed has no bounce so the sofa is highly recommended. Food is to die for and is very cheap to dine in with room service. My partner and I both had our own executive poo loos, although she took a fancy to mine more. Lol

Review: On arrival the staff were so polite and helpful. Stayed during the pandemic and everything is so clean with all safety measures in places and everything cleaned thoroughly. Pool and changing rooms were in immaculate condition with a booking system to ensure there wasn’t too many people in the pool. Can’t wait to come back and stay again! The hotel is right in the middle of the royal mile - meaning you are a short distance away from the station, castle & other attractions. I would highly recommend this place for its cleanliness, safety & location. Everything was in walking distance.
Title: Amazing!!

Review:
This hotel is essentially a castle, just down from the actual castle, on the Royal Mile. Step out the front door and you’re on the royal mile central to all the big attractions, pubs, tours. whisky etc etc etc. 
Despite being so central the hotel itself is a haven. It’s quiet, air conditioned, comfortable, and the staff are great. Raddison Blu are always good, add to that the Edinburgh charm and you’ve got someone you’ll wish you lived! 
Roy, the concierge, is amazing. Made my birthday extra special.
Title: Hard to imagine better

Review: The location of this hotel is just ideal, bang in the middle of the Royal Mile, our window was overlooking some of our favourite pubs which we enjoyed though maybe not ideal if you are bothered by noise. Room was stunning and a great size with a king size bed and comfy corner couch also.  Breakfast and bar areas were well serviced and laid out for social distancing which was reassuring. I definitely hope to return.

Review:
This was our first overnight in Edinburgh and we are so glad we picked the Radisson hotel. 
The evening took a turn when my partner became unwell with chest pain and we had to call an ambulance to the hotel, we informed staff of the situation and they were very attentive and helpful during a worrying time, the night manager (Tom I think?) came to us and introduced himself, he was very kind and let us know to contact him if we needed anything. The staff brought my partner water and eventually we were able to head up to our room after the drama.
Besides this, we had such a comfortable stay, the room was spotless, the staff were very friendly and professional.  The customer care and whole experience was second to none. 
We will return soon hopefully for a more chilled out stay!😊 Thank you so much.
Title: Very enjoyable stay! 5 stars from us.

Review: The property location was very easy to find the property itself was lovely, as soon as we walked in and requested information for the spa usage the concierge came right over and book the whole thing for us was fantastic service walking straight through the door! The rooms are spacious, modern and very up-to date, the spa and pool facility’s are fantastic although the steam room and sauna weren’t in use at our time of visit I’m sure that would’ve put the icing on the cake for us, spa treatments and staff for the spa facilities are second to non!
Title: 5th/6th September couples stay review

Review:
The hotel location is excellent for all the main tourist attractions and also a number of bars and restaurants.
The hotel and room was clean with all safety measures in place.
Staff were helpful upon arrival.
Shower was hot and powerful, bathroom in general was a good size.
Rooms were spacious with plenty or storage.
Despite the city centre location the hotel was quiet during the night.

Review:
The people, rooms facilities, dining were all exceptional. The double bedroom was a great size with lots of space and clean lines! The shower was powerful and really helped me to wind down.
The staff at reception with lovely people very helpful; the restaurant was fantastic.
For a hotel In such a central location to what’s going on in town I’d say that the price was outstanding and pretty much unbeatable comparatively.
Title: Down and they were removed within a few minutes.  to sum up this was an epic stay.

Review: The hotel is in a superb location.  The ease of accessing the hotel from the car park and returning securely to the car was also excellent.  The staff attended to all our requests immediately.  The room was spacious and the facilities were very good.  The hill view rooms were just what we wanted, and we got two rooms next door to each other!
Title: Fabulous family break in a hotel which provides excellent service and is in a prime location.

Review:
Cannot recommend this hotel enough, Paul at reception looked after us from the moment we arrived.
The hotel accomodated our early check in request, upgraded our Room for free and also gave us a late checkout of 4pm so we did not have to carry our bags around the city whilst awaiting our train home.
Room was spacious and comfortable, breakfast absolutely delicious.
Will absolutely be returning
Title: Exceptional

Review:
The hotel is well situated, on High Street, near the railway station, close to the Edinburgh castle and Princes Street, so it’s easy to walk from there almost anywhere you want to visit.
The breakfast was good, lots to choose from at the buffet.
The beds were amazing, after walking all day it was easy to relax and just drift off into sleep.
Title: Great hotel

Review:
It was my husbands birthday and the receptionist ‘Igor’ went above and beyond his duty to make sure our stay was special ie rose petals and chocolates in room. Also complimentary drinks.
The room was large with a great view of Arthur’s Seat. The bed extra large and very comfy. Parking was at the hotel at a good reduced rate also. Late breakfast time and a good choice. 
Great location, can’t wait to go back.
Title: Most enjoyable, we will be back.

Review:
Amazing in all the aspects: location, staff kindness, quality, comfort and facilities. Close to Airlink 100 stop (coach to airport). Few steps from Edimburgh castle, old Town, Holyrood palace. The beds are extremely comfy, the breakfast has lost of options, the best omelete I’ve ever tasted and gluten free options. There is a bar opened 24h. You can storage your luggages. They let us early check in. 
I can just congratulate the manager, staff and all the employees for such a great service that really became our time in Edimbrah special.
Title: The best breakfast ever!!!

Review: The location was perfect for us.  It was central to the Castle, pubs, restaurants and shops.  The breakfast was a bit disappointing.  There was a long queue on Saturday morning so we stood for about 15 minutes.  We were only offered one cup of coffee or tea.  The selection was reasonable although the hash browns were terrible, they were pale in colour, undercooked and mushy.
Title: Great location, stylish hotel but the standard of the breakfast could improve.

Review: The hotel is stunning, perfect location, staff were incredible, on site parking, great bar, and I got upgraded to a suite after a lovely chat with the receptionist, and the rooms are incredible - very clean, spacious and great facility's all round. Breakfast is worth the money as well with such great selections available. The location is perfect for where ever you want to go. highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Edinburgh even for a night.

Review:
I Loved the Radisson Blu, the Staff are so lovely & helpful. The location fantastic as were the rooms. The facilities excellent too, overall a perfect Hotel to stay in right in the Heart of This wonderful City. 
Plenty of Restaurants, Bars, old style pubs & the live Music is just fantastic. 
You are 5 mins walk from Festival Theatre...perfect!
Title: Exceptional

Review: Perfect location on the royal mile and walkable to everywhere. 10 mins walk from tram stop. Staff lovely, rooms big and beds massive. Breakfast excellent and bar really good atmosphere. Could not fault. It was my birthday and the hotel went above and beyond really - gave us a bottle of Prosecco, free drinks in the bar and upgraded us. Paul on reception particularly friendly and lovely. 10 out of 10.
Title: Fabulous

Review: The hotel is in an ideal location right on the Royal Mile and is furnished to a high standard. Breakfast was fantastic and the bar upstairs was great too with phenomenal service from the staff going above and beyond to make a cocktail for my fiancé which was not on the menu. The room was cosy with a really good shower.

Review:
The hotel is on a busy straight with loads of activity, restaurants and pubs . It is a stones through from the castle and everything is a stones throw from it . Most we had to work to an attraction was 10 mins . 
Check in was super easy and Flynn have us some advice on the best places to shop and eat , and how to get there . Room was amazing super modern , spacious and clean . Bed was a queen size and very comfy . Bathroom is clean and spacious with a great shower and toiletries. Food and drink are super tasty just a little expensive. All the bar staff are very friendly and Aaron served us one night and we had a lovely chat with him . Hotel felt very like home and was super toasty and warm during the winter In Edinburgh. 
We also got white chocolate covered strawberries on arrival, a lovely gesture
Title: Excellent

Review:
The hotel is on a busy straight with loads of activity, restaurants and pubs . It is a stones through from the castle and everything is a stones throw from it . Most we had to work to an attraction was 10 mins . 
Check in was super easy and Flynn have us some advice on the best places to shop and eat , and how to get there . Room was amazing super modern , spacious and clean . Bed was a queen size and very comfy . Bathroom is clean and spacious with a great shower and toiletries. Food and drink are super tasty just a little expensive. All the bar staff are very friendly and Aaron served us one night and we had a lovely chat with him . Hotel felt very like home and was super toasty and warm during the winter In Edinburgh. 
We also got white chocolate covered strawberries on arrival, a lovely gesture

Review: The hotel was in a brilliant location and the rooms themselves were comfortable and nicely decorated. I don't think there was much 'superior' about our room apart from the superking bed, I don't think I would of forked out the extra money for that type of room. The staff where lovely and attentive and helpful! Couldn't fault them at all. Breakfast was brilliant with the pancake maker too!
Title: I would recommend but maybe not worth the upgrade to Superior

Review: Hotel was in an ideal location, staff were friendly.
Title: Exceptional

Review: Hotel was in an ideal location, staff were friendly.
Title: Exceptional

Review:
Wonderful staff - very professional, helpful, friendly and efficient. The room was clean and comfortable and in good order with a great view out to the Firth of Forth and Arthur's Seat. The bed was extremely comfortable and with the pillow menu, made for a great nights sleep on both of the nights we stayed!
Room service breakfast on the second morning was excellent and is recommended for a relaxing way to start the day. The concierge on duty was brilliant  - really chatty with a fount of local knowledge. He was very helpful with booking tickets; recommending restaurants and making dinner reservations on our behalf.
The hotel is in a great location on the Royal Mile, just a few minutes walk from Princes Street, Waverley Station, Grassmarket, Edinburgh Castle and Holyrood and well placed to explore the atmospheric 'wynds' and 'closes' 
Will definitely stay again!

Review:
Wonderful staff - very professional, helpful, friendly and efficient. The room was clean and comfortable and in good order with a great view out to the Firth of Forth and Arthur's Seat. The bed was extremely comfortable and with the pillow menu, made for a great nights sleep on both of the nights we stayed!
Room service breakfast on the second morning was excellent and is recommended for a relaxing way to start the day. The concierge on duty was brilliant  - really chatty with a fount of local knowledge. He was very helpful with booking tickets; recommending restaurants and making dinner reservations on our behalf.
The hotel is in a great location on the Royal Mile, just a few minutes walk from Princes Street, Waverley Station, Grassmarket, Edinburgh Castle and Holyrood and well placed to explore the atmospheric 'wynds' and 'closes' 
Will definitely stay again!
Title: Very comfortable hotel & well located to explore the wonderful city of Edinburgh!

second visit here and as before superb staff are very helpful, polite and professional.

hope to return soon

Review: Location is excellent but this does come with a downside in the early hours of the morning! As it is pretty close to the nightlife it becomes pretty loud out on the streets & with no "proper" double glazing... Room was well appointed but I have stayed in better for the price. Good buffet breakfast. Good attentive staff throughout the Hotel.
Title: Very good just a bit too pricey

Review: The hotel was in a good location about 10 minutes away from the Christmas market. parking behind the building was handy and reasonably priced. The room was spacious and clean, bed was very comfy and loved that they had 2 different types of pillow. We payed extra to have fresh rose petals on the bed and chocolate strawberry’s in the room, the staff were very discreet meaning this remained a surprise. Had a lovely view of the hills from the window. Tv in the room wasn’t great, didn’t have many channels to choose from. Little step to get into the bathroom which wasn’t an issue but could be easily tripped over.
Title: Wonderful

Review: Lovely clean hotel in an excellent location. I have stayed in a lot of hotels and this was one of the best EVER, staff were very friendly and welcoming and could not help enough. We arrived early and they took the luggage from us and when the room was ready took our luggage up, all while we explored Edinburgh without dragging our baggage with us. Bed was very comfortable and the room was spotless. Did not come across a single member of staff who was not smiling and courteous. An absolute credit to your company. We will be back and would definitely recommend it most highly 👍👍👍
Title: When you book the right hotel you can relax and enjoy making memories

However on the first day we were not asked if we wanted anything from the cooked to order menu and assumed this was all part of the buffet. On second day we were asked and the cooked items we ordered were very good
Title: Overall we enjoyed our stay and particular thanks to the 2 concierges who were both very helpful

Review: In my opinion Old Town is the best place to stay in Edinburgh and therefore location of the hotel is great as it is in the center of old town. Major attractions are in easily walkable distance (5-10mins) such as Waverley Station, Waverly Mall, Victoria Street, Grass market, Edinburgh Castle, St Giles Cathedral, shops and most importantly lot of restaurants of almost every cuisine in this area. Value for money and good breakfast.
Title: Great location and value for money, good breakfast

Review: location was fantastic, window view of the royal mile, and waking up to the sound of bag pipes felt lovely, room was spacious and clean, bed was very comfortable, room service great, hotel bar fantastic service, great selection of drinks, cocktails etc and they even delivered cocktails to our room.  walking distance to Edinburgh waverly, shops, George Street, Castle.  perfect for couples & families.
Title: wouldnt book this hotel again.

Review: The hotel is within a stones throw away from the main tourist attractions. It sits just on the Royal Mile . The Queen’s holiday castle in Edinburg , haollyrood is about 8 mins walk. The castle is a about 22 mins walk . The hop on hop off buses are like 10 mins walk or less . Very good breakfast and u can order ur eggs from menu on top of the fried eggs and scrambles eggs that are served in the buffet.
Title: Perfection in all sense of the word. If I am ever back in Edinburg, I wouldn’t stay anywhere else !

Review: This was a great base on the The Royal Mile, close to shopping, attractions, pubs and restaurants.  The staff were very accommodating and friendly.  If you have a car, than you get to enjoy resident rates on parking - a big plus for us. You are within walking distance to Edinburgh Castle, Calton Hill, Princess & George St shopping - pretty much everything in the Old Town.  Recommended.
Title: Easy, friendly, and close to everything.

Review:
The staff's service was far beyond our expectations especially from a night shift guy named "Thomas" if I'm right. We stayed on 17Sept-18Sept. We got an excellent service of food and the late check-out. We got the offer of 3-4 hours additional late checkout without any charges. The staffs were very kind, and we feel very welcome to stay in this hotel.
Dear Thomas, if you have read this message from us. Please reply or contact us back, my fiancee felt really appreciated by your exceptional service !!
Title: Excellent staff service mind.

Also we left our passports in the safe and the concierge organized a driver(naturally at our cost) to drive from Edinburgh to London to ensure the safe delivery of our passports. Review:
Location is everything! Right center of the city, on Royal Mile. It's lively and around all the shops, restaurants. Walking distance to everything. We visited during the fringe festival but even with all of that crowd we did not hear the noise. We liked being right across from 3 great bars!
Staff is (okay) friendly. Room was clean and neat. We stayed for two nights then again one night after a Tour of the Highlands. And since it was my birthday, they brought cupcakes to my room and one "complimentary" drink. though it was one :( So my friend was not able to join me :(
We had breakfast one of the days, and it was good. They also offer GF bread which was amazing.
Title: Clean, comfy & right in the center of the city

Review:

We had breakfast one of the days, and it was good. They also offer GF bread which was amazing.

Review:
Location is everything! Right center of the city, on Royal Mile. It's lively and around all the shops, restaurants. Walking distance to everything. We visited during the fringe festival but even with all of that crowd we did not hear the noise. We liked being right across from 3 great bars!
Staff is (okay) friendly. Room was clean and neat. We stayed for two nights then again one night after a Tour of the Highlands. And since it was my birthday, they brought cupcakes to my room and one "complimentary" drink. though it was one :( So my friend was not able to join me :(
We had breakfast one of the days, and it was good. They also offer GF bread which was amazing.
Title: Clean, comfy & right in the center of the city

Review:
Located right on the Royal Mile half way between Edinburgh Castle and Holyroyd 
Attended during the fringe and the hotel was an allocated venue plus very close to many others
A short walk from the station 
Very friendly staff the bed was huge and so comfortable Room and bathroom clean 
Breakfast is remarkable I’ve never seen so much choice plenty of helpful staff 
Spa and pool very welcome 
Would thoroughly recommend

Title: Very Good

Review:
The breakfast not great ,potato scones were always dry and hard  the eggs over cooked fried or scrambled.
poorly  grilled tomatoes  and  mushrooms boiled. cant speak regarding meat products as I do not eat meat.
I understand its buffet and volume cooking but more attention to freshness by less quantity being prepared 
and refreshed more regular would eliminate some problems.
Would have preferred pancakes pre made, the machine was very slow when working and did not produce great quality
pancakes.  
Service was quick and good staff were very pleasant and efficient.
Title: We had a pleasent stay and liked our room the location is great for visiting Edinbourgh.

Review: The property could not be in a better location. Perfect for restaurants, sites etc. could not be more perfect. The rooms were spotless. I was at the front of the hotel looking into the Main Street and it was completely silent in my room . It is a very comfortable room with modern amenities and everything you would need. The tv was huge as was the bed and I liked the large comfy couch and desk. The bathroom was also huge. It is a great hotel. A bit pricey but worth the money. You cannot go wrong staying here. The breakfast was excellent and I had a fresh made cooked omelet everyday I was there. It was gorgeous. The buffet has everything anyone would want from fruit to pancakes to eggs bacon and sausage,fruit juices and every bread imaginable. An excellent buffet. Would I say here again? Absolutely in a heart beat. Loved Edinburgh and love this hotel. The spa is great and got a manicure and pedicure from them. Wonderful pampering offered.
Title: Fabulous location

Review: The breakfast was exceptionally good! Delicious, freshly-cooked food at a reasonable price. The bar staff were very friendly and the list of drinks was comprehensive. My son and I appreciated the very central location, just off the High Street, and it was a major bonus to have a car park on-site.
Title: Perfect place to stay while visiting Edinburgh.

Review: We were thrilled with Radisson Blu.  It was immaculate, beautiful, and the staff were wonderful.  We definitely will be staying there again when we visit Edinburgh, and I am looking at other Radisson Blu properties in other cities for our next trip.
Title: It was a wonderful hotel that made our trip to Edinburgh even more memorable .

Spacious and spotless room in a very smart hotel right in the heart of Edinburgh old town.
Parking on site was a bonus at a reasonable price for our rental car.

That said plenty of great bars outside the front door

Review: The location was excellent being right at the centre of the Royal Mile. The hotel was modern and very clean throughout. All the staff were excellent. They were very helpful and friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them. The room was very clean, spacious and very well maintained. We arrived at the hotel a little earlier than the check in time and were given a voucher for two complementary drinks and snacks at the bar.
Title: An excellent hotel that we would return to and also recommend to family and friends.

Review: Unbeatable location in the Old Town on the Royal Mile, in an attractive, architecturally sympathetic building that was only built in 1993, though you wouldn't know it. There is a degree of the impersonal about this hotel though it was very comfortable and modern. We did not visit the bar or restaurant on site and so cannot comment. It was easy to leave our bags at the desk after check-out as we had a late flight, and we were also able to access the hotel spa for a last minute shower before heading to the airport for our long flight, although we did not take advantage of that in the end.
Title: Unbeatable location in the Old Town, charming hotel, a bit impersonal, but overall very good.

Lovely pool in the spa facility - a peaceful and relaxing way to start the day.
A small point, but I loved the way the mirror in the bathroom had a non-steamed-up area in the middle - have never seen that before!
Title: Not cheap but a nice litle blast of luxury for a two-night stay

Review:
We were given a really huge room that included a double bed, two singles, a sofa, and a small 'play area' (I think it was a family room, there were only two of us). The default option when you turn on the TV is to 'stream your own content from a device' which is great because we wanted to watch on-demand shows from our tablet.  
Great central location close to Edinburgh Castle.
Clean room, friendly staff, lots of breakfast options.
Title: Would stay in this hotel again

Review: Location wise this hotel is perfect, everything is within walking distance and the pubs opposite are brilliant. The staff are extremely helpful and hotel is immaculately clean. We didn't use the spa facilities as we were too busy exploring but had we have had more time we would of as it looked great. We were celebrating both my birthday and our first wedding anniversary and were greeted with a complementary bottle of prosecco and chocolate covered strawberries in our room which was a really lovely touch.
Title: Great location terrible breakfast

Review: This hotel is in the middle of Old Town- which is the destination in Edinburgh.  We could walk out of the front door in either direction and quickly arrive at Edinburgh Castle or Holyrood Palace.  Old Town consist of many shops and restaurants.  Upon check-in, several restaurants were recommended, all within walking distance.  Several are Michelin restaurants.  The rooms were very clean and the bathrooms were quite large.  The room was very modern and updated.

Review: I loved everything about my stay at Radisson Blu Edinburgh! Incredibly courteous and helpful staff, amazing hot stone massage from Chloe at the spa, ideal location, brilliant decor - both interior & exterior, tasty breakfast includes everthing you could possibly want, exceeded my expectations! So pleasantly surprised with how well I was treated as a guest here. This was my first time staying at a Radisson Blu, and I joined your membership & requested my company to cancel a booking they made elsewhere so I could extend my stay here! Thank you so much, highly recommended & I cannot wait to return.
Title: Best stay hotel experience I’ve ever had!

Review: The hotel is conveniently placed right in the centre of Edinburgh's old town and just 5 minutes walk from Waverley train station. The room matched our expectations, as did the staff and everything else about the hotel. We especially appreciated how clean and tidy everything was kept. Things like being able to choose just the right type of pillow are exactly what you need when on vacation, walking all day and exploring the surroundings. Wi-fi was great and it was very easy to watch our own content on the TV.
Title: Exceptional

Review:
The hotel was in a perfect location on the Royal Mile only 15 minutes from Edinburgh Castle with many attractions and restaurants only around the corner and a 5 minute hike upwards from the train station. They provided a nice touch for my partners birthday and arranged for a cake and chocolate strawberries be delivered to the room.
The breakfast options were wide but the hot food buffet wasn't the best, albeit there was a wide selection. The cold food options tasted much better from the buffet. The options for eggs cooked was a nice touch, given we could chose from omelette/ eggs benedict and boiled eggs, the first two were great :)
Title: Lovely hotel and spacious rooms with great views in an ideal location

Title: Very Good

Review:
The check in was impressive with the man that checked us in. Interacted well and took an interest in what we were doing for the weekend.hopefully he had a good weekend in Milan.
The location of the hotel was perfect and close to all restaurants, bars and attractions. 
The room was fantastic and a good size room with a really comfortable bed and had everything you could need. 
Breakfast you had a really good selection of food and it was never too busy. 
Overall will be coming back at some point in the future and look to stay at other Radisson blu hotels.
Title: Exceptional

Review: The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The hotel itself is right in the centre of Old Town and is in a fantastic location for exploring various tourist attractions in Edinburgh. We stayed in a Premium room and it was spacious, modern and had a view of the royal mile. The bed was one of the comfiest we've slept in at a hotel in a long time, and the shower was excellent. All-in-all it was a wonderful stay, and I highly recommend it to those seeking accomodation in Edinburgh.

Everything from the cleaning ladys to the front staffs in the Reception was perfect. We misunderstood our reservation we thought it’s was Breakfast included but it wasn’t but the hotel upgraded us with a free Breakfast and invited us a drink on the Hotel bar and we will say thank you very much for making our stay so remembering.The beds was very comfortable never slept so well on a hotel.
Hotel was very good located as well  We are very grateful for all the staff did for us. Highly recommend we will be there again soon.

Review: We were surprised by how large room 364 was, very spacious and comfortable. We made use of the fridge in the room, having brought sandwiches and the complimentary water in the room. The view of Arthur's Seat and the sea was a lovely sight to wake up to, even on the misty mornings. Two of the mornings we woke to clear blue sky and no clouds, perfect for exploring the city. The hotel was perfectly situated for all the activities we had planned for our stay. We also made use of the pool facilities, which was a perfect way to end our stay.
Title: Lucky - the perfect weather for a city break!

Review:
Great location, very comfortable and clean rooms. Its one of the better hotels I have stayed in recently and for the price the best hotel I've stayed in in the UK. 
Can't comment on the Spa or other facilities including food as it was a very short stay and I did not use them. 
Only thing to be aware of is check-in is at 3pm but I could store my luggage in reception and it was dutifully waiting in the room for me when I arrived later that evening. 
From now on this will be my hotel of choice in Edinburgh.

Review: This is our second time staying at this Radisson Blu and we absolutely loved it. Special shout out to Claire and Jessica who went above and beyond for us. We came to celebrate our birthdays and were pleasantly surprised to receive a really nice card as well as free drinks at the bar. When an alarm went off in our room (malfunction), it was promptly taken care of and we also received free drinks and snacks due to the inconvenience. You can tell that the staff really go above and beyond here! The room is gorgeous, the location is absolutely perfect, and the pool area is so relaxing.
Title: Great Location, Great Staff!

Review: It was a fantastic stay for our Anniversary last weekend, I had mentioned that we were celebrating in the notes when booking the room but did not expect any kind of special treatment. When we arrived our room was amazing, with fantastic views and staff had hand written and anniversary card for us. Complementary glasses of champagne were provided, chocolate covered strawberries as well as a small gift of chocolates & Biscuits. It is a FAB hotel, amazing staff and will definitely be returning - THANK YOU VERY MUCH!
Title: Amazing, Fabulous, fantastic - Thank you

Review:
I was upgraded to a beautiful suite.  The bed was the comfiest I have ever slept in!  I thought I was being really picky about asking to change my pillows (after I read about the different types) but the room service people were so lovely and the firmer pillows arrived in no time and made all the difference.
The staff were so helpful and I had a great time.  It is the best of the various Radisson Blu hotels I have stayed in, in terms of facilities, staff helpfulness and comfort.
Title: This is a really lovely hotel whose staff go out of their way to be helpful and friendly.

Review: We really enjoyed our stay here. Staff went above & beyond to ensure our night was special as we were celebrating. Perfect night!
Title: I’d recommend this hotel to friends & family & looking forward to returning!

Review: The room was excellent, location was perfect.
Title: Great trip away, would use this hotel again.

Review:
The room was very spacious for a city centre location. The bathroom was also a good size. Great size for two adults to share. 
Location - absolutely perfect. Easy walking distance from all major attractions including the castle, Grassmarket, National Museum, the Palace and Parliament Building. Waverley station is a 3 minute walk where the airport bus drops you off and you can get the open top bus. 
Staff - arrived at 9am and the reception staff found a room available for us (which we did not expect at that time). Very accommodating and the concierge advised us how to obtain entrance to the castle, royal yacht and the open top bus for a combined price, saving us quite a lot.
Title: Perfect location, friendly staff and clean, large rooms.

Review:
Visited with a friend for my 60th birthday. Staff were wonderful so helpful. First surprise on arrival got an upgrade WOW!! Then bottle bubbly on ice and cup cakes in our room Amazing!! Next day received complimentary afternoon tea and cookies. Great hotel beautiful clean room with comfortable bed, loved the swimming pool and spa facilities. Breakfast delicious. Overall a Great experience!! Will book this hotel again for sure hopefully this year. 
Thank You

Review: We loved absolutely everything. Our room was beautiful and we did not expect to be like that! We had the 8th anniversary being together and it became our tradition to go for a "anniversary city break" every January. This time it was amazing again and in our room there was a champagne and biscuits for us and it was a terrific surprise. We loved comfy beds and nice view. A breakfast was great, there was a good choice of everything and I absolutely loved and avocado toast. Staff is very nice and friendly and they would do everything for you. The hotel has great location and there are many shops and restaurants around. I would recommend it 10/10 :)
Title: Ah-mazing hotel, great staff, nice view, comfy bed, warm welcome ♥

Review:
The staff were amazing. I needed to arrange a little Christmas magic for my daughter and they were so helpful. Problems were dealt with right away and they went above and beyond to make our stay special - one of the restaurant staff even worked with the kitchen so my daughter could have a carrot to give Santa for his reindeer. Lovely all round. 
The pool was fantastic & mostly empty & the buffet breakfast was fantastic value as kids eat for free when an adult is eating. Really great hotels for families. Everything you could want to see is an easy walk away.
Title: Christmas in Edinburgh

Review: The location of the property is brilliant and the staff are really helpful. The buffet breakfast had a wide choice and the food was too a good standard. They have their own car park which is really easy to find. We parked on Floor 4 and had garage access to the hotel. The beds and pillows were so comfortable enabling us to recoup for the next days exploration. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Review: Absolutely everything. The location was incredible, staff went above and beyond to make our stay special and the room was modern and spacious. Travelled for my boyfriends birthday and there was an iced cake waiting in the room along with two glasses of prosecco and a card from the guest relations manager, a lovely touch. Concierge were amazing and always welcomed with a friendly smile and chat as soon as you walked into the hotel. Would be back in a heartbeat.

Review: The staff primarily - incredibly helpful! Got a personal visit from the manager to try and fix the tv/telephone issue the same night I reported it. To be fair to them I didn't report the ongoing issues with the Chromecast or Wi-Fi after that, as I'd given up by that stage. Great location, and loved the decor. Itchycoo Bar (love the name!) Has great cocktails and amazing bartenders.

Review: We had a little problem with the hot water. After trying to contact the front desk where there was no reply (probably busy) we contacted the concierge Kevin, who could not do enough to sort the problem. We've usually found at other hotels the concierge to be a little dismissive because they are so busy. Kevin is the exception to the rule and a huge asset to the hotel.
Title: The radisson Blu in Edinburgh is in a prime position and is definitely worth a visit.

The gym was nice and the swimming pool area looked lovely, although we did not get a chance to use it. Breakfast was lovely and even included a pancake machine! Staff were very helpful, especially Brian on the front desk who was a wealth of information and managed to sort out tickets to Edinburgh castle!

Frequent traveller, really lovely hotel, all decorated beautifully for Christmas. The staff were really friendly and helpful can't wait to stay again. The room was very clean as was the rest of the hotel. Very comfy beds and great spa facility well priced also. 
I took my boyfriend for his birthday and they went the extra mile for that too. 
Excellent location for the city, 2 min walk from train station and parking attached to hotel.

Review: We had a fantastic time at the Radisson Blu Hotel - the staff were fantastic.  A very special mention to Claire (customer relations) who went above and beyond to ensure we had the most wonderful stay in Edinburgh - such a fantastic experience.  We will definitely be staying here again.  Excellent location, excellent staff, beautiful food and world class facilities - what an amazing welcome and absolutely excellent Customer Service.
Title: Absolutely Fantastic - amazing staff, warmest welcome and excellent facilities

Review: The breakfast was acepable but  not great
Title: Ideal location

Review: Adored our stay! Clean, tidy, well kept generally, good food, lovely small spa included in price, good value treatments, excellent location, bed was amazing - pillow menu!!! Easy parking at good price (£12.50 for a night)   One reception member stood out for being helpful and happy - she was delighted for us that we were self driving to Skye. She oozed enthusiasm in a genuine way - it didn’t feel at all put on. (Blonde lady, working late evening on Wed 7 Nov - I wish I knew her name as I would love her to get recognition.)
Title: Faultless. Would love to go back.

Title: Incredible luxury stay and fantastic location! Highly recommend

Review: Fantastic location on the Royal Mile, it couldn’t have been better placed! Short walk from the train station, approx ten mins walk to a lot of the main attractions, the hotel bar was nice and nearby there are plenty of eateries (booking definitely recommended) this hotel was perfect and good value for money and would happily recommend. It also looks like a castle from the outside which is an added bonus. Our room was ready early and the breakfast was nice, good variety and quality food. We had a wonderful weekend here and would certainly stay here again.
Title: Exceptional

Bathroom was well equipped with a good shower. Room was surprisingly quiet considering the location so obviously well insulated. Spa facilities were wonderful with a lovely pool, steam room and sauna.
Title: A lovely night away in a great location.

Review: I liked the surprise birthday gifts waiting for me and the upgrade to a business room.  I also liked plenty of mirrors to get ready. The staff took notice of the Do Not Disturb notice and got into the room when we went out briefly so it was ready when we got back.  Late night staff were very obliging when my friends and I arrived back and sat up late asking for drinks, food etc.  I used the gym which was good for a general workout.

Review:
Room was fabulous, seems like it was recently refurbished given it's modern interior. 
One improvement would be to have a walk in shower rather than a bath tub however that is just my personal preference.
Location was perfect - right on the heart of the royal mile.  Hotel parking was easy to find.

Review: This was an amazing hotel. You cannot beat the location. When you walk out the front door, you’re right on the royal mile, in the middle of the action! The room was large and comfortable. The bed felt like a fluffy cloud and there was even a couch in the room for reading and relaxing! Parking was very convenient and we liked that you could go straight from the parking garage to the hotel through a back entrance.

Review:
The location was great, very close to the castle and Royal Mile. 
We had a superior room and the bed was amazing, so comfortable that you almost won’t want to leave the hotel to explore the city. 
The room was clean and had all the amenities needed. Thanks to Magdalena for the room service. 
The pool and steam room were also nice to have at the end of a long day in the city. 
We were able to store our luggage until 7pm the day of the checkout which was very convenient with our late flight.
Title: Amazing hotel, ideally located!

Review: This hotel is right in the centre of Edinburgh the castle is at the top of the road - the station down the road ! Generally the breakfast is very good fresh poached salmon and good service

Review: Large comfortable bed and a substantial room. The windows are triple glazed so although the room overlooked the main tourist street, it was very quiet. I left my passport in the safe but the staff organised a taxi to bring it to the airport really quickly - thank you for that.

Review: On site parking was a bonus although quite difficult to park anywhere when you first arrive as only taxi rank immediately outside hotel. We pulled up briefly there while one of us jumped out of car to check in and get access to hotel car park
Title: Overall a great place to stay and excellent location which is very accessible to most attractions

Review: The hotel is perfectly located in the middle of the Royal Mile! The bed was very comfortable and there was adequate closet and storage space. We had a great view all the way down to the water (Room 470). The hotel restaurant is open until 10:30 which was nice when we returned late from sightseeing and still needed to eat a little something.  It was a great stay and I highly recommend it if you want to be within walking distance of most attractions.

Review:
The service was excellent, everyone was so friendly. It was our 30th wedding Anniversary and they left us fizz and chocolate strawberries. Room was lovely and spacious with a view ew of the mile.
just perfect....
Title: Exceptional

Review:
The service was excellent, everyone was so friendly. It was our 30th wedding Anniversary and they left us fizz and chocolate strawberries. Room was lovely and spacious with a view ew of the mile.
just perfect....
Title: Exceptional

Review:
First, the check-in staff were very good. We arrived very early and our room wasn't ready so they looked after our bags, organised some refreshments and arranged a tour for us. Similarly, when we needed a last minute dinner booking for Saturday night, concierge was able to recommend a very good restaurant and arrange a table for us. Thank you Kenneth!
The suite was gigantic with a separate lounge room and dining area. Bedroom was large also. Only point I'd make is they could have cut down on space in the hallway or lounge room to make the bathroom bigger - bit of a squeeze for two people simultaneously. Bed was very comfortable and linen nice and cosy for cold nights in Edinburgh!
The bar staff were friendly and hospitable with a good selection of drinks. The decor and appearance of the hotel are gorgeous and totally in keeping with the old town Royal Mile.
A very enjoyable stay in a well run, friendly, luxury establishment. Would come back in a heartbeat.
Title: Absolute luxury, excellent location, brilliant staff.

The bar staff were friendly and hospitable with a good selection of drinks. The decor and appearance of the hotel are gorgeous and totally in keeping with the old town Royal Mile.
A very enjoyable stay in a well run, friendly, luxury establishment. Would come back in a heartbeat.
Title: Absolute luxury, excellent location, brilliant staff.

Review:
First, the check-in staff were very good. We arrived very early and our room wasn't ready so they looked after our bags, organised some refreshments and arranged a tour for us. Similarly, when we needed a last minute dinner booking for Saturday night, concierge was able to recommend a very good restaurant and arrange a table for us. Thank you Kenneth!
The suite was gigantic with a separate lounge room and dining area. Bedroom was large also. Only point I'd make is they could have cut down on space in the hallway or lounge room to make the bathroom bigger - bit of a squeeze for two people simultaneously. Bed was very comfortable and linen nice and cosy for cold nights in Edinburgh!
The bar staff were friendly and hospitable with a good selection of drinks. The decor and appearance of the hotel are gorgeous and totally in keeping with the old town Royal Mile.
A very enjoyable stay in a well run, friendly, luxury establishment. Would come back in a heartbeat.

Review: The hotel's location can not be beat.  We were right on the Royal Mile and walking out the door you were immediately immersed in Fringe events and the old town.  The rooms have been renovated and the air conditioning works really well.  The views from the window over the old town were beautiful and we could even see the fireworks over the castle at night during the Tattoo.  The bathrooms were nicely appointed and there was enough room to place two suitcases without having to maneuver around them.  The wifi at the hotel was really good.  The television had lots of channels and the pool in the basement was good for the kids.  The food in the restaurant for breakfast was good with tons of choices.  Even a pancake machine that the kids enjoyed making their own pancakes with.  The food and service in the Itchycoo restaurant was good and they had great choices.
Title: Middle of the Action in Edinburgh, would stay again.

Review: The location is perfect for exploring central Edinburgh and is especially good for the Festival.  Rooms are well-appointed with comfortable beds and excellent pillows.  There is a good functional bathroom, with adequate shelf space.  The breakfast service is efficient and there is a good selection of hot and cold food.  Front of house and wait staff are all friendly and helpful.

Review: Excellent location, just in the middle of The Royal Mile! Car park is available for £12.50 per day which is quite cheap in Edinburgh. Room had plenty of modern solutions and fittings to make guests feel comfortable. Polite staff, you can request a quiet room at the back of the hotel. We stayed in cheaper hotel for a first night and regret we didn't pay more to stay in Radisson! Rooms were very  clean, bed comfortable :)

Review: Shocking hotel management.  Had to get a change of room.first room was dirty,bed was 2 singles pushed together, mattress was filthy. Shower was broken and dust everywhere.  Second room was clean but mattress sagging in the middle. Noticed after a massage in morning there was no hairdryer in the room,my partner had to check out with wet hair.  Also no hot water in the morning,when I asked reception they said it's because they were busy. I complained to management and was told I would get a 20%refund.  In my opinion I have had better rooms and under £40. I have stayed in a few raddisson hotels around the world all were excellent. This was the most disappointing stay anywhere.
Title: Worst nightmare

Review: Second time staying at this property. Location was great however standards have definitely slipped. Poor communication from front desk when complaining on check out after being placed in a room facing a noisy street. Kept awake from 1-4am with loud shouting and screaming from the pubs and clubs after paying £195 for a superior room. Told we were not entitled to compensation as we only complained after check out! Despite having a video showing the amount of people and noise levels. We were not told this room was noisy and very disappointed. Definitely would not stay again
Title: Fair

Review: Booked for two nights, checked out after one night and booked at the InterContinental The George. I showed pictures to the Manager [and another Lady] of what a run down state the suite was in and also the corridors in terms of the carpets and door casings. It was warmer on the streets of Edinburgh than it was in the room, absolutely freezing. For the money I paid it was a complete let down. We went to eat in the Restaurant downstairs, word of warning...make sure you have your thermals on, it was freezing! Whilst at the same there was a squadron of fruit flies persistently doing a fly by.
Title: Complete let down!

Review:
Location is brilliant, central yet calm, ok decor. Downstairs area for guests to sit and wait is great. Simon, the operations manager, despite his young age was very professional, energetic, smart and had outstanding listening skills and got the job done most efficiently.
He would make an outstanding hotel manager in my opinion and could be seen running everywhere 'putting out fires' due to limited staffing, I suspect.  Reckon should be poached by 5 star with more funds and better staff schedule mgt (here resources too low to do this well). Pool area is good. Spa is outsourced and has friendly personnel and good treatments. 
Bed was very comfortable and had good bedding. New room after cleaning mishap was clean and comfy and all our things were moved by them at my request so our day could keep going withoit further hassle. Check out time was flexible (12pm to 1pm) which was great for late departures/ later plane. Reception staff overall professional, responsive and doing their best. Female manager ok, but seemed just a good receptionist, not an energetic decision maker.
Great to have taxis in front of hotel and all tours close by and Edinburgh castle about 10 min away.
Airport bus connection (last stop) at bottom of hill. Steep 5-10 min walk to get to hotel, but managed with my 9 year old.
Title: Good central option for quick city break

Review: The front desk staff were all brilliant. Very polite and very helpful. I didn't get their names but there was an Irish girl, an African chap and an American chap. They could teach the restaurant staff a thing or two about providing a service. We arrived early and checked in but the room wasn't ready so they took our bags and we went for lunch. The room was nice and clean. The shower was really powerful. The bed was extremely comfortable. No complaints about the room at all.
Title: Don't bother with the breakfast

Review:
Sadly our stay was not as memorable as it should be due to a fire drill during the night where the fire evacuation process was very poor. There were no correct evacuation process, no fire wardens on sight when we had to evacuate. I had to wake my young children and have to go down 6 flight of stairs into the freezing cold in the middle of the night. The most disturbing thing is that the fire alarm was triggered by someone smoking on site. To our disappointment, the hotel did not take into account the distress me and my young children had to face in the middle of the night out, having to risk going down these stairs while children were half asleep into the freezing cold, extremely frightened. The hotel took no responsibility to the distress and discomfort caused to my young children. 
We tried to ask for a refund for the distress and disturbance caused. The reason I am writing this review is not that of the false alarm and but the hotel management did not seem to be too concerned about our ordeal we faced or the fact the incidence could have cost us our lives.
Title: Okay

Review: The only downside (albeit significant) was that for the 3 days we stayed there, there was no hot water in the morning due to the number of guests staying at the hotel. So if you stay there when it's quiet you won't have a problem, but if you stay when it's busy, expect to have your showers either late in the afternoon or late at night each day. The other downside was that consumables were not replaced, such as sugar and coffee but that was not an issue for us - may be for others.
Title: Good stay.

Review:
The staff for the restaurant/bar area on the evening of 5th September, could’ve had better manners and better seating area’s for food as we were going to eat at the restaurant and sadly couldn’t and didn’t want after our interaction with one of your male waiters that evening there was also an elderly lady trying to eat her dinner at a sofa and coffee table she was very uncomfortable, the lounge area isn’t suitable for dinner accommodations. Also not very accommodating trying to eat or order dinner while other members complaining at the front desk which could be heard from where we were sitting. 
The morning of the 6th we went down for breakfast to take to our room as soon as we arrived there was another member no very happy with his cutlery, we shrugged it off until we were seated to wait for our breakfast(to take to our room) we also noticed dirty cutlery at the table we were glad we were getting separate cutlery or I would’ve complained also, at current situations it’s no acceptable for a hotel of such high standards to not have clean cutlery, 
Overall if all the spa facilities were in working order, the staff had a nicer approach and the cutlery was clean it would’ve been fantastic.
Title: 5th/6th September couples stay review

Also not very accommodating trying to eat or order dinner while other members complaining at the front desk which could be heard from where we were sitting. 
The morning of the 6th we went down for breakfast to take to our room as soon as we arrived there was another member no very happy with his cutlery, we shrugged it off until we were seated to wait for our breakfast(to take to our room) we also noticed dirty cutlery at the table we were glad we were getting separate cutlery or I would’ve complained also, at current situations it’s no acceptable for a hotel of such high standards to not have clean cutlery, 
Overall if all the spa facilities were in working order, the staff had a nicer approach and the cutlery was clean it would’ve been fantastic.
Title: 5th/6th September couples stay review

Review: Pool was still out of order due to a technical issue.
Title: Excellent stay

Review: Finding a parking place can be difficult at peak times. People had parked on ramps making access to some levels ‘tricky’. We stayed for 4 nights over the long bank holiday weekend and one weekday. At check in we were told that breakfast time is till 11am. However on the morning of our checkout we were told that the breakfast is till 10:30am on weekdays. We had to miss our breakfast  and the breakfast staff could not do anything else even for our 1 year old. We did complain about this and the person checking us out did compensate us for this error on the hotels behalf.
Title: Very Good

Review: We requested extra bed for our 8yo child. They didn't have it in the room when we arrived, but the member of staff at reception assured us it would be in a room within minutes. We went out for dinner and when we got back couple hours latet, the extra bed was still not there. Had to go to reception and ask for it again. I must say it did arrive within minutes after that. That was a minor thing, I'm not too worried about that, otherwise, everything was great.

Review: Very comfy beds
Title: Great staff

Review: Very comfy beds
Title: Great staff

Review:
We had an issue with the staff one night, my friends were having a gathering downstairs because some of them smoke, they were not disruptive or making a mess, but a person on the staff saw them drinking some whiskey, we were after all buying whiskey that day and they were trying some out, and this person took the bottle from them, without reason, and the explanation was ridiculous, like we don’t allow drinking here? I guess they don’t allow it if you don’t buy it at their bar or something, because the glasses and ice they were using were from the hotel bar, they asked for them. Anyway, later one they ask for our property back, the bottle, because it was ours, but I wouldn’t have let them take it on the first place, if you don’t want your passengers drinking on your premises ask them to move it to the room or leave the space, but don’t touch what’s not your property.
Two nights later or so we actually went to the hotel bar, charge what we had to our room, left, were just getting settled when they called us because they couldn’t find our credit card on the system or something, we had to get back down and tried to sort it out, but the truth is we never understood what was wrong with the card they had entered when we checked in; they even asked if I wanted to put that charge on another credit card, which I said of course not, they had a credit card on their system and that was the card they should use for the charge. After not learning what went wrong, or what they actually wanted, we finally went to bed. This whole thing could have been resolved the next morning, but no, we had to try and resolve it right then and there.
Title: Great hotel

Two nights later or so we actually went to the hotel bar, charge what we had to our room, left, were just getting settled when they called us because they couldn’t find our credit card on the system or something, we had to get back down and tried to sort it out, but the truth is we never understood what was wrong with the card they had entered when we checked in; they even asked if I wanted to put that charge on another credit card, which I said of course not, they had a credit card on their system and that was the card they should use for the charge. After not learning what went wrong, or what they actually wanted, we finally went to bed. This whole thing could have been resolved the next morning, but no, we had to try and resolve it right then and there.
Title: Great hotel

Review: Lovely and modern
Title: Exceptional

Review: We had the same person check us in and check us out the following day - he was arrogant and almost looked bored to be at work - no smile, not trying to help when asked questions, one word answers (as if it what we were asking was obvious). Everyone can have an off day, so we put it down to that.....then had the same person check us out - no smile, no ‘how was your stay’, ‘did you enjoy Edinburgh’ - nothing!!! There were no queues, hotel was quiet due to the current corona virus. All other staff were super and friendly. We are not put off staying again - just pointing out

Review:
Bin in bathroom hadn’t been emptied.

Disappointing that the spa shut on the Monday due to maintenance (the day we planned to use it - before our journey home). The hotel did offer us use of another spa in a different hotel, but the half a mile walk to and from the property was a put off for us after spending the weekend walking right around the city.

Title: Exceptional

Review:
The spa. Split between the hotel and a private company. Could not book required treatments or times. Decided to swim,. got changed,went to the pool and immediately slipped.on a puddle and went up in the air and landed on my knee. It swelled X 3. There was nobody to help,no first aider,no medical help at all. To be fair they offered to pay for a taxi to A&E @ 2000 on a Saturday night in Edinburgh between Christmas and Hogmanay?
In the morning they paid for the taxi, arranged for a wheelchair  and an member of staff to accompany us.
Title: Great staff, great f9d

Review: I wouldn’t say the breakfast is worth the £21 you pay for it, people may think otherwise. There was a good selection - everything from an English/Scottish breakfast to cereals and pastries however in my opinion a short walk up/down the road leads you to many other cafes and breakfast places which are much cheaper and nicer.

Guinness, A Cider, Coors (Canadian I think), and a Czech lager -  not one was an Ale or even worse, a local beer!
Title: A comfortable hotel in a prime location.

Review:
We booked as two couples and we got a larger room with seating area, whereas our friends got a much smaller room with no seating etc. Their room was also not soundproofed (double glazed windows?!) which made sleeping difficult as it faced club/pubs on the adjacent street. It would have been good to have had rooms of the same quality especially as we paid the same amount (which wasnt cheap!).
The TV in the room said we could connect to play own content however this was not possible despite trying. Biscuits with the tea and coffee facilities wouldn't have gone amiss!
Title: Excellent

Review: One of the 3 elevators stayed out of operation for the whole period of our stay. This was a problem during breakfast time.
Title: Wonderful

Review: I paid extra for a premium room with a city view. There was just a small view of a street near by and there was no sofa area as advertised when I booked it. They had forgotten to put a cot in the room which they confirmed they would do when booking, so we rang for one which was brought to us but this was a broken one so we had to ring to get another one which got sorted. On check in we were not told about any facilities at the hotel we could use or where breakfast would be served and times for this. We were told to come back at 12.30/1pm to check in and when we arrived back to check in at 2.15pm we were told the room still was not ready for another 20 minutes which was unfortunate as our baby needed to settle with warm milk and a nap.
Title: Really lovely stay just a few things could have been improved

Title: Wonderful

Review: We had the cleaners knock on the door at 9 o'clock in  the morning waking us up,  when we had until 12 o'clock to check out
Title: Very Good

Review:
Reception staff at check-in refused to check my wife in when she arrived at the hotel without me, even though she knew the details of our stay. They were unnecessarily brusque.
This was only resolved by phoning the venue of the conference I was speaking at and asking me for the credit card details of the booking.
This problem was compounded by the manager coming to the room, admitting the receptionist had been brusque and defending their policy. A simple apology would have helped. 
I have never had this at other hotels where we have arrived separately - not an unusual occurence. 
Most decent hotels whose staff have misjudged a situation apologise and make some small gesture of goodwill - Radisson Blu could learn some lessons from them.
The result was we ate elsewhere and spent no more money at the Radisson.
When asked how was your stay on checking out we were subjected to further rounds of defence of their policy with no recognition of the embarrassment and stress caused to my wife.
Title: Good

Review: I felt that for the price we could have been provided with some extras as my little girls was with me, no fluffy bath robes, little biscuits or snack in the room upon arrival as would be expected in a four star. The tv didn’t work each time it was turned on I had to call for assistance and the light above the bath was out making the bathroom dark.

Review: The only thing I didn’t like was that housekeeping did not clean our room during the day when we were gone. We left the room early morning and didn’t return until early evening to see our room wasn’t cleaned at all and we didn’t have any new towels, etc. But we called the front desk and they brought up towels for us almost immediately and then shortly after housekeeping came to clean the room.
Title: Wonderful

Review: The only thing I didn’t like was that housekeeping did not clean our room during the day when we were gone. We left the room early morning and didn’t return until early evening to see our room wasn’t cleaned at all and we didn’t have any new towels, etc. But we called the front desk and they brought up towels for us almost immediately and then shortly after housekeeping came to clean the room.
Title: Wonderful

Review: Having to get out of bed to leave
Title: Exceeded expectations and that was down to the staff

Review:
on check in the receptionist immediately pushed the upgrade option to a junior suite. when asked what was the advantage  we were told it would be a nicer room with a better view. As we had already booked a superior room we declined. we thought the whole process could have been handled better. e.g the receptionist could have begun by saying " we do have a special offer today ………...etc"
When we reached the our room
1)  it was extremely cold as the thermostat was set to 17. however we were able to adjust this and after about half an hour the room warmed up.  
2) the  joins on the hessian type wallpaper were beginning to come away in about 4 separate places,
3) there was a lot of accumulated dust on the skirting board below the window.
4) when we put the room card for the lights into its holder on the wall the front casing fell off,
We mentioned all of these points to a lady who was cleaning the next door room and she said she would make sure all of these points would be corrected, We then went out for a quick snack and when we returned after about an hour all of the above points had been dealt with.
Title: Overall we enjoyed our stay and particular thanks to the 2 concierges who were both very helpful

Staff member that shifted us was very helpful but only gave us a free drink in the bar for all the inconvenience.

Review:
We upgraded to a ‘junior suite’... very spacious, but seemed to me to be a family room masquerading as a suite... the lounge area had a sofa bed, instead of a couch and chairs, which was very uncomfortable to sit on... and the heating on one side was a bit dodgy.
Also, ate in the bar area one night... must have had junior staff both as waiters and in the kitchen...sent a meal back.
( And as per previous feedback I’ve made for Booking.com- if you select you want parking it should be included in the price and not an expensive extra )

Price, very expensive.
In the description of the hotel its mentioned 4 minutes walking from edinburgh waverley station, which is correct; however, you need to go up the stairs (high stairs) between buildings opposite to the station. Title: I w

Review: Mixup with our reservation.  We requested two beds, and that was not available on check-in.  No hair dryer - such a small thing!  And no fridge in our room, though there was space for it.
Title: Great location, clean, quiet and comfortable.

Review:
We were given a disability room which I need because I can't walk very well.  That was fine but the room was also wheelchair friendly with low wash basin, low everything in fact and only one armchair.  It was also quite a hike to and from reception/bar/restaurants, so not ideal.  But no complaints, they did what they thought they needed to do..
The hotel is a bit of a maze and quite difficult to work out access between garage parking, bedroom and reception..  Reception at ground level is on the same level as level 4 in the car park and the lift near our room did not take us down to the level of the breakfast room.  So all a bit of a traipse.
Title: A very good hotel in the centre of the Old Town

Review: The breakfast spread needs improvement. The breakfast area is also small and it takes time to have something as you have to make orders for even simple things such as boiled eggs etc. Here I see a room for improvement. Cost on a bit higher side. So, overall it has to balance a bit to make it truly value for money hotel.

Review: The bar fridge was nor well stocked and the room did not have milk and other standard items expected.   It was if the room was not ready or properly serviced. Expect way more from that price.   Breakfast was weak.  Nothing special and i got better breakfast at hotels half the price.

Review: The bar fridge was nor well stocked and the room did not have milk and other standard items expected.   It was if the room was not ready or properly serviced. Expect way more from that price.   Breakfast was weak.  Nothing special and i got better breakfast at hotels half the price.
Title: Wonderful

Review:
The lift from the car park was broken had to carry suitcases up three flights of stairs to get from the car park to reception. The car park is under the hotel. 
They didn’t have my booking but “found a room” this was disappointing has we had been booked months in advance.  Had a 4th floor attic room which felt cramped with sloping roof and not the superior room I booked. 
Tried to charge me £290 a room not the £232 on the booking.   Good job I had the booking on the booking.com app as proof.
I booked breakfast but when we went to breakfast was told that we were not on the list for breakfast and they had to “find” a table. 
The staff were very nice and helpful and sorted everything thing out but it really should not have had to have been sorted out, in the first place.  
Just a bit disappointing and we felt we had to check everything, so we actually got what we had booked and didn’t get overcharged.
Title: Good location but a disappointing experience

Review:
Definitely a business hotel and not a luxury one.  Had everything you need but quite basic.  
The room I checked into had a broken phone line and aircon wasn’t working.  However, the night shift reception, Joaquin, showed 5 star professionalism and hospitality.  He left his desk to show me possible rooms that I could move into.  Within 30 mins we had a new room with phone and aircon.  To no fault of his, unfortunately, this room was also flawed as when I checked the bathroom sink, it was full of mud.  Housekeeping had not done their job.  When I let Joaquin know, he offered and insisted that he come and clean the sink for us.  Since I had a long travelling day I declined his very kind offer and let housekeeping handle it the next day.  If it weren’t for Joaquin, I would have rated this hotel pretty poorly.  Luckily he saved the reputation of the hotel somewhat.
Title: Good

Review: The people on the desk at check in could do with a personality makeover. The girl that checked me in I think was French I couldn’t tell exactly but by the few words she spoke. She never once looked at me. She was the most impersonal person. No she was actually downright rude and almost cost this hotel a good review. Don’t put rude people on your desks. There are a few of them at this hotel. The desk people are your ambassadors. You need better representation. Although the concierge desk gentleman was very nice and helpful. You could be five stars if you sent your deck people to training in how to deal with the public and customer service.
Title: Fabulous location

Review: Access to and from the car park is ridiculous! The tiny ramp includes a right-angled bend which is so narrow that two cars, one entering and one exiting the car park, cannot pass. Why has the large area of hardcore directly in front of the garage entrance not been developed to widen the entrance/ exit and take out the right-angle bend?
Title: Perfect place to stay while visiting Edinburgh.

Review: Access to and from the car park is ridiculous! The tiny ramp includes a right-angled bend which is so narrow that two cars, one entering and one exiting the car park, cannot pass. Title: Perfect place to stay while visiting Edinburgh.

Title: Excellent

Review:
Pillows: too fluffy and soft. A lower and firmer pillow is needed, although i noticed that this is an issue in all Radissons i stayed in.
Breakfast: i understand that the room can be busy, but i was never offered coffee or a la carte menu. The attending staff seemed more focused on some customers rather than other.
Restaurant: very very slow service from the kitchen. It takes a long time for the food to come out. I had to wait 46 minutes for burgers and chips (they were average, making the whole long wait even more frustrating).
Title: Nice hotel near Royal Mile and the castle.

Title: Wonderful

Review: When we arrived early, at 1130,we were told our room was not available but they could hold our bags so we were able to go out and see some of the area. We returned at 1630 and were told our room was still not available even though we were supposed to be able to check in at 1500. The staff person then went away and came back and said she could give us a better room and it was ready. She called it a superior room which is what our booking indicated.
Title: This is a fine hotel and in a great location but you pay quite a premium for that.

Review: When we arrived early, at 1130,we were told our room was not available but they could hold our bags so we were able to go out and see some of the area. Title: This is a fine hotel and in a great location but you pay quite a premium for that.

Review: Not all staff were knowledgeable about processes and our check-in on our return stay and very slow and tedious.  The check out was equally slow...and most disappointing is that they couldn't award our points award number.  We didn't have the number readily available on check-in... we had just been given it a few days prior.  But on checkout when we did have it, the staff member was very confused and didn't know what to do.  Don't promote something that your staff aren't able to speak to...especially since we had just been there 3 days prior.
Title: Very comfortable hotel in an ideal location in Old Town Edinburgh.

Review: The steam room wasn't working and I thought it was expensive for a room only rate.

Review: We had booked a superior room in Edinburgh, and having stopped in the same type of room at other Radisson Blu hotels we found standard items that were in the rooms at other hotels were not found in the Edinburgh hotel room e.g. slippers (to go with the robes that were in the wardrobe), coffee machine, biscuits.
Title: An excellent hotel that we would return to and also recommend to family and friends.

Review: I was a little disappointed with breakfast although the variety and choice was good the quality of the cooked food was not the best as the bacon was very fatty and the hash browns were very dry and tasteless. The customer service was also very abrupt and not very friendly in the breakfast area no smiles friendly conversation or anything I felt a little uncomfortable and the man gave off the vibe he was too flustered and a bit annoyed which was a shame as it was my birthday and my last morning in Edinburgh (which is my faveourite city) before heading home.
Title: Short but sweet good location and room only let down by Brekafast

Title: Would recommend the hotel and would stay again

Review: I would have liked more personal service, but I think with the volume of guests coming through such an iconic location, you cannot avoid a degree of impersonality--service was always friendly and professional, but ultimately disinterested, which is fair enough for a big city. The porter took our bags to the cab rank after we checked out, and expected a tip, which we were not prepared for (coming from a society that rarely tips for service). We felt slightly embarrassed by this, as we have not experienced any such expectation travelling throughout Scotland for over three weeks.
Title: Unbeatable location in the Old Town, charming hotel, a bit impersonal, but overall very good.

Title: Remains my favorite hotel in Edinburgh.

Review: Although the room we had which was a superior room was very roomy with all the facilities you need the bed was uncomfortably soft. It was two beds placed together with a mattress topper on the top. The pillows were equally as soft and even when we requested firmer ones they were still really soft. Breakfast was really poor. I thought we had booked this in with our stay only to be told on the final morning that we hadn't and we would be charged, this would of been perfectly fine had the breakfast been nice and had I of know after the first morning we would of eaten elsewhere as breakfast was pretty rank and not quite as they describe it online and for £12 each we could of eaten in one of the many cafes on the mile for less and probably enjoyed it.
Title: Great location terrible breakfast

Review: I sent an email ahead as I had made 2 separate bookings and wanted them to be merged on arrival so I didn’t have to check in again. The hotel confirmed this could be done. When I arrived back at the hotel on the second night i went up to the room to find my card had Been disabled and I had to go back to reception, provide new ID, and re check in and get a room card. I also think the room could be better equipped for the price, eg. A coffee machine, dressing robe and slippers, choice of newspapers on arrival etc.
Title: Very Good

Review: I think the headboards in the bedrooms need replacing. Second time we've stayed recently and the finish on them in both rooms was worn and scratched
Title: Very Good

Review:
My only bug was the lady restaurant manager on the first day when we came down to breakfast seemed like she was annoyed with me and was very short. I know it’s busy but she was really off with me /short and unwelcoming, and I don’t know why. 
The next day I had the same thing and my friend had to try and order an omelette three times and it still never turned up. Other tables who came in after us got their breakfast orders. 
I don’t think it’s fair to colour the reputation of the hotel based on this one aspect, the staff overall were brilliant and the breakfast buffet items were great but the service at breakfast was the only issue I had. The restaurant as a whole, the food when we did get it was excellent. 
I’d recommend the hotel for sure and I will stay there again. I just wanted to flag my only issue in case it helps the hotel manage quality.
Title: Fantastic

Review: Public areas are quite busy, crowded and stressful most of the time. Reception staff are fast and efficient but they are a bit overworked. Hotel could hire more of them. Room service breakfast was a bit average (cheap though). The hotel is not cheap. OK for business travel where someone else is paying but probably too pricey for a tourist budget.

Colleague would have preferred extra pillows which were not available in the room.

Review: I didn’t like that the bottles of water were only complimentary if you joined the Radisson Blu Club. There was no bar fridge in the room and the coffee supplied in the room was instant - no coffee machine. In the bathroom there were no extra toiletries like a vanity set or a shower cap. I’m not sure if this is because we were in a standard room but if it is - shame on you Radisson Blu.
Title: We loved Edinburgh and our stay was still thoroughly enjoyable.
