Review: On the breakfast the hot food options weren't the best, i.e. the sausages had a strong taste of herbs to them and the bacon was still fatty around the edges which wasn't our preference.
Title: Lovely hotel and spacious rooms with great views in an ideal location

Review: The superior room was in what felt like attic conversion with low ceilings and a tiny window. I know it’s a traditional property but I’d say the room we were in was more of what I’d expect in a standard room in a hotel of this quality. There was a pillow menu left on the bed which would have been ideal if there had been any alternative pillows available. When calling reception to request an anti allergy one we were told there were none. Not ideal when all the pillows in the room  are soft feather ones. What might be “luxury” for some isn’t for others.
Title: Very Good

Review: I would like to have made use of the pillow menu, as the ones supplied were by far too soft and shallow for me and my partner. Also, the toilet was a little too high for my short legs, which dangled a bit. I have in the past pulled my Achilles tendon from another hotel with this same issue, so it is a concern of mine. We were awakened on our first morning at 9am by the cleaning service as we forgot to use the do not disturb sign, but as it was our first day we felt we didn't need anything.
Title: Lucky - the perfect weather for a city break!

Review: Absolutely nothing, I think personally the breakfast could of been a little bit better but that’s my opinion.
Title: Exceptional

Review: Had requested a room with non feather bedding. The one allocated had feather bedding . Whilst this was changed, it did take an amount of chasing to get this done.
Title: Good

Review: When we first arrived we went into the bar for a sandwich, the choice was very limited. What we did have was nice enough, although £8 for basically a cheese toastie was a bit much.
Title: We enjoyed our stay very much and will stay at the Radisson Blue again.

Review:
Didn’t enjoy the hot buffet breakfast. The fried eggs were hard as left under heaters, bacon was cooked but not crispy and the bean juice was all over the counter where people had to leave the spoon.
Always prefer cooked from the kitchen and the only time consuming thing for the hotel would be cooking the eggs to order. 
The restaurant felt a little soulless.

Review: Buffet Breakfast could be better.  Huge selection of juices, fresh fruit, cereals, cold meat and cheeses, make your own pancakes and even a small menu of made to order, but if you prefer the Scottish Buffet breakfast it could be improved on. Eggs were overcooked, hash browns could be hot, Black Pudding was about 4 inches thick and undercooked.  Sausages and Bacon were delicious.
Title: Exceptional

Review: Buffet Breakfast could be better.  Huge selection of juices, fresh fruit, cereals, cold meat and cheeses, make your own pancakes and even a small menu of made to order, but if you prefer the Scottish Buffet breakfast it could be improved on. Eggs were overcooked, hash browns could be hot, Black Pudding was about 4 inches thick and undercooked.  Sausages and Bacon were delicious.

Review:
I booked the more expensive room that should allow you to "upgrade" your bed - so if you want different cushions or a harder bed they can make it work for you. My bed was so soft that you literally rolled to the middle and could not move... Asked them to change it and they said it's not possible. So definitely not worth the extra cost at all.
There's also no mini bar in the room. You have to request one, and after the bed let down I just wasn't in the mood to ask. 
The cost of room service is exuberant due to a "plate charge" that they add.
Title: Good

Review:
Booking.com added VAT and charges to the room before I completed my booking. That is a fault with B. COM not the hotel. It is customary in the UK to include VAT on the website initial room price not to slip it in as the booking is completed. This was an extra £60+.
Aircon in room blew cold. In Feb. Complained. Got a complimentary  dinner and radiator. Did not want to change rooms. Would
Title: Good

Review: For the cost of the 2 nights I was a little disappointed in the bedroom.  It was not really any larger than a double room and had no sofa or minibar. I am surprised that I paid what I did for the type of room we received.

Title: Staff very helpful and friendly. Enjoyed the stay and everything was local

Review:
The heating wasn’t working in my room, I was freezing. I reported it twice and asked for a blanket, which was kindly brought to my room. I was offered an electric heater, which I declined.
My bathroom was an accessible bathroom, which I did not request and it was quite annoying as it was shower only and everything was very low down (to cater for people who are. only able to sit on a chair in the shower)
I ordered room service for my evening meal (veg curry) and it was really tasteless and a bit cold by the time it got to me.
Title: Room for improvement

Title: Very enjoyable.

Review:
We had a minor problem in that when we arrived there was someone else's food in the mini bar (always makes you wonder what else they missed!) but it was dealt with quickly. 
Other thing is that the room descriptions aren't consistent across their marketing materials so we thought we had booked one thing and ended up with another but the staff were wonderful and we ended up in an even nicer business room which really made our stay.
Title: Christmas in Edinburgh

Review: The iron had a hole in it, so the entire contents leaked out soaking the ironing board and my shirt. The tv didn't work at all to start with, and after maintenance checked it the Chromecast worked maybe 20% of the time at best. The telephone line was faulty, it took about five goes to get to reception each time, at which point the line was terrible...like a very poor mobile call, but on a landline. The Wi-Fi was incredibly bad, lost connection to the internet all the time - the Chromecast had a permanent "unable to connect to internet" error. And as a last point, the hot water tap in the bath is well positioned for a shower, but if you're having a bath it means having to stand up every time you want more hot water.
Title: Great staff!

Review: Housekeeping came to clean the room whilst we were still in it. We were getting ready to leave (it takes my partner extra time as he’s disabled) and he told her we would be out in 20 mins if she wanted to come back. She handed us some clean towels and a couple of bottles of water and that was it. The room wasn’t touched until we left the next day. No clean cups/glasses, no fresh hot drinks or milk. Not good enough for a 4* hotel. I’ve had problems with the housekeeping not doing their job at this hotel on previous visits.
Title: Pleasant but still niggles with housekeeping %

Review: On check out we were told we had booked breakfast as a package for the duration of our stay when we checked in. We were not told this when checking in, so only had breakfast one morning out of two. The hotel tried to charge us for the breakfast we hadn’t had and said there was no refund available. This was a shame as the rest of the stay was great. This rule should be changed! Who would pay £25 for two breakfasts that they didn’t have! I await my refund!

Review: Breakfast was decent but a bit cold. No extra blanket for the bed despite the baltic weather outside. We arrived early from the airport at 9am but the room understandably wasn't ready. We were told to call back at 2pm but they promised to ring if a room became available beforehand. No phonecall came. When we came back at 2:20pm, we were left in the lobby waiting to get our bags. Check out was also slow. The superior room was nice but nothing more than standard.
Title: Nice hotel

I realise due to their religion they must be covered up but that should not stop the experience for other guests.

Review: The heating in the room was hopeless. The room never felt warm only took the cold off.
Title: Excellent

Review:
The bar restaurant area was strange in that it didn't feel right for a bar in that all the seats and tables were for dining. Not very comfortable for sitting laid back having a drink. That said there was a separate area with more comfortable seating.
The breakfast fried food is stored in heated lidded containers to keep the food warm. This can result in the food becoming overcooked if stored for a long time. This is also common in other Raddison Hotels I have stayed in and degrades the quality of the food.
Title: Lovely stay in nice hotel

The fire alarm call in the late evening/ early hours was unexpected but I'm glad it worked - however the execution was very poor with staff directing us to the front of the hotel with no one actually appearing to know where we should go!!

Review: Our one-night stay was near-perfect, EXCEPT for one specific thing:  The caustic, cheap-smelling air freshener used to "neutralize" smells in the rooms (and, I found, elsewhere on the property, such as public toilets).  This wasn't a "signature scent" of the brand -- it's something commonly used to neutralize rooms and, in my case, brought on near-allergic reactions.  I remember the same scent being used in Aloft Hotels and in the Penguin, a cheap motel in South Beach.  But I digress.  The first room my business partner was assigned had that scent, and she couldn't be in it for more than a minute.  We asked for another room, which the hotel quickly gave us.  Thanks!  My point in all this -- there must be something else that can be used as this freshener, as it instantly brought "cheap hotel" to mind for me.  And this property is not a cheap hotel in any way, except for that scent.  Thanks for the opportunity to comment! Eric Allen / Madelyn Hammond, staying on 9 Oct 2018.
Title: Thanks for great hospitality!

Review:
While the mattresses and pillows were extra comfy, we had two single beds pushed together. Staff insisted this made it a king size bed. It does NOT for a couple. I spent half the night in-between the beds. There were no other rooms available the second night. Better fixings are required for the beds (you get them in other hotels).
It was positive to have a pool in a hotel in this location, however it was hidden underground and not very appealing for us.
Title: Great location, and amazing breakfast, but require better "double" beds.

Review: Room was pretty warm and air conditioning seemed not to be working properly. We reported the situation twice but no there was no improvement. We had to open the window of the room to get some fresh air and then the noise from the festival (all night long until 7 am) didn’t allow us to sleep well. As a result, we decided to cancel another reserved night at Radisson and moved to another hotel. Not having air conditioning properly working is not acceptable for such expensive hotel.

Review: The hallways in the hotel smelled a little like an old locker room.  I don't know if that is because the windows were open or if the floors need to be cleaned.  The staff upon entering the hotel to check-in were a little slow and not as welcoming as they could be.  The bathrooms have a door stop on the floor for the bathroom door, however the door stop is on the floor right as you would step out of the bath.  My daughter stepped on it when exiting the bath and almost fell.  It is a potential liability waiting to happen.
Title: Middle of the Action in Edinburgh, would stay again.

Review:
Couple of disaster i book the Raddison as I’ve stayed in the Glasgow Raddison blue and red a couple time with my partner. And had excellent service starter the sauna wasn’t open even tho I called befoe making the booking and was told it was, I no it was because of cov19. I understand completely; just lack of communicating I feel. the fire alarm went off twice during our stay; room service wasn’t available a few times that we called down. broken lamp next to the bed. we asked for towles  couple of times to wash our self and was only give hand towles im not the biggest and I struggle to dry myself with them.  Room view was ok thought be a little better for the price paid. 
Thanks Mairi
Title: Disappointing

Review: unfortunately we stayed before the lockdown again on the 7 oct 3 nights,  breakfast was very nice the food was of poor standard,  the room was nice enough ,  the restaurant experience was ok ,  the pool we used twice th first time was fine but the second time my husband and my self were swimming and a family of 6 came got in the pool , the signs around the pool clearly stated 3 only in the pool my husband and my got out as we felt pushed out , i asked the receptionist why she allowed them in the said they are the same family .  very irresponsible thing to do under the covid rules , we complained but heard nothing from your hotel

Review:
Dinner menu too basic, but of course #duetocovid.
Hotel too cold, but of course #duetocovid. As if turning the heating off creates "fresh air".
Mattress was a bit odd. Sort of sunk into the middle and swallowed you up. Climbing out in the morning got the heart rate going. Kind of comfy though. Some odd scratch marks on the bed head.

Review: Breakfast very disappointing. It was always cold and shrank as week went on. From a small bowl of beans and 2 eggs, to a saucer of beans and only one egg with the cooked breakfast. Everything apart from the toast and eggs had obviously been pre-made and sort-of reheated. The staff were always helpful though and I’m sure I could have asked for more had I wanted to.
Title: Good

Review: The staff are the same as they were last year..abrupt verging on rude.

Review: Dry blood on bed sheets. Sheets didn’t fit bed, every time we moved the sheets exposed the mattress which was not ideal. Didn’t replace amenities in bathroom after first night. Compared to other 5* hotels in Edinburgh this was nowhere near. I’d say more 3*

Title: Not 5*

Review: Tv not working we were given another but with very limited channels. Room serviced one of the towels was dirty, had to take it to reception, given fresh towels. Breakfast was disgraceful I appreciate there are covid restrictions but to charge £21.90 per person per night which is the price the hotel advertised for breakfast when there was a choice of a Scottish cooked breakfast, omelet, porridge and avocado on toast, this I don’t think is value for money. Also your table is cleared when you get up to get orange juice and cereal, this was virtually all that was offered for breakfast
Title: High expectations of a blu standard hotel not realised

Review: The bed was very soft. Not your fault. I should have asked for a firm bed..
Title: Thanks to your staff for making our anniversary special

Review: Cleanliness and housekeeping. Honeymoon weekend having just got married during Covid crisis. You would think cleanliness would be a priority. Booked a superior room. Was told it had been cleaned and was ready. Checked in and went to room. Having a look around as you do. Someone’s old dirty top was on the floor behind one of the chairs! Obviously not a thorough clean! I hat else hadn’t they checked or cleaned! Complained and moved rooms. Next day went out and again room was supposedly cleaned while we were out. However they had failed to change the pillowcases because it was still covered in make up from the night before! If they hadn’t changed those this meant they hadn’t changed the sheets at all as the pillow was on top. I go home also means they probably hadn’t cleaned the room again. The rooms are not cheap and this is supposed to be a quality hotel but housekeeping t had let you down twice. How can anyone be sure they are safe in your hotel In Times or Covid. I have emailed the company twice and had no response. Once while still there!! Very disappointed and put a dampener on the oi mi I honeymoon. It had been a stressful enough week with getting married and cancelled reception meaning hardly any family due to Covid. We did not have the luxury of postponing. We treated our selves to this break in o give us a good start to married life. I wouldn’t have thought dirty rooms would be on the agenda!!
Title: Housekeeping needs to up their game and should be checked more!!

Review: We had a number of problems. First our tv didn’t work night one. Then we had to move the next night as they couldn’t fix but only had standard rooms and we booked superior room. Key cards didn’t work twice so had to change. Breakfast was ok but cold day one. Bar area was terrible had to drink in a different area as main bar full of non residents. It was as if we had stayed at a Travelodge and not a 4 star expensive hotel. Would not recommend to anyone.

Review:
Paid for a premium Room with a large double bed. 
On booking in the hotel explained they had no double bed left. Two twin beds were given pushed together. 
Obviously booking.com has no priority over hotel bookings direct. 
The hotel took payment for something they didn’t have. 
I should have paid less for what was given. A twin standard room. 
Won’t go back.

Review: First night ate in the Bar restaurant. Waiter not wearing face masks or gloves, only four items on the menu, one not available, housekeeping staff not wearing gloves or masks. Breakfast each day people sitting directly above us with no screens. On checkout got surprised with 12.50 / night car parking. Expensive for what it offered and certainly didn’t inspire confidence.

Review: Only bad thing was the bed. We had the junior white for 2 nights. On day of arrival my wife got a treatments package. Set her up nicely for the days ahead and the bed was horrible. 2 single beds stuck together and they kept providing a gap, so woke up with really bad back pain and one leg trapped down the middle of the bed. Really wasn’t amused
Title: Stay was good! Service was great just bed was horrible for the money we paid

Review: Rang to ask if pool was open - told no... but was ! That’s why we chose a hotel with a pool, especially at £150 per night
Title: Great location , but disappointed in facilities

Review: The check in was longer than necessary. Things were not working. After returning home we were horrified to find that we had been charged 3 times the hotel rate as our credit card had been debited 3 times. Rang manager who apologised and said overpayment would be credited back that day but still in dispute with our credit card company. Also advised we would be offered a free or reduced rate 2 night stay including dinner BUT STILL WAITING FOR THIS OFFER, We are not holding our breath.
Title: Stressful, wish we hadnt booked

Review: I didnt like that on booking website it was not clearly stated that we had only room stay, no breakfast included. Breakfast was not great anyway. Also, we had superior room with castle view - haha, not! We had roof view with two seaguls and a mountain, no visible proper castle. No little fridge inside hotel too.
Title: Read well before booking

Review: I didnt like that on booking website it was not clearly stated that we had only room stay, no breakfast included. Breakfast was not great anyway. Also, we had superior room with castle view - haha, not! We had roof view with two seaguls and a mountain, no visible proper castle. No little fridge inside hotel too.
Title: Read well before booking

Review:
We paid to upgrade to the Royal mile suite and really wish we had not bothered. It was very tired looking and drab. The dining table was disgusting and looked very dirty (although I appreciate some of the stains could probably not be removed.)
The remote control in the bedroom had been sanitised and was wrapped up the living area one was not wrapped which made me wonder if it had been sanitised.  
Complimentary mini bar was advertised and totally understand this has been removed due to Covid but maybe a complimentary drink in the bar would have been nice to replace this.
Title: Pleasant stay but probably would choose somewhere else next time in that price range.

Review: As a disabled person I rang the hotel about the parking. I chose it because it had on site parking. They assured me it was available. However when I arrived after a long drive, I wasn't able to park. This was both upsetting and embarrassing.
Title: Pleasant

Review: As a disabled person I rang the hotel about the parking. I chose it because it had on site parking. They assured me it was available. However when I arrived after a long drive, I wasn't able to park. This was both upsetting and embarrassing.
Title: Pleasant

Review: Man on reception was very rude. Bathroom shower head was broken, no cups or heating, again when we complained the man on reception was rude. We complained to the manager he was super helpful changed our room and gave us a complimentary drink, and apologised and reassured us that he would be spoken too. This was our 40th annerversary which was ruined!

Title: Pleasant but some difficulties due to effects of COVID.

Review:
A few issues: 
1. We booked a royal mile suite so you expect everything to be of a high standard. However the a wardrobe door was hanging off the frame. 
2. A lamp plug was damaged. 
3. Phone didn’t work up on arrival 
4. BREAKFAST arrived cold and was very poor value for money. The replacement was no better. On the second day one breakfast was forgotten. It just wasn’t up to the require standard.
Title: Would not choose a Radisson hotel in the future based on the experience.

Review: Room was a bit tired, and a bit dusty. Felt clean from a Covid point of view though. Team and coffee tray was disappointing. Review: Where do i start from checking in on monday  24th august checked out wednesday 27th august giving us the total wrong room paid for superier room just gave us a normal standed room until i complained then the man on reception said sorry said he would put us in a premium room which was meant to be better than a superier room but when we got into the room it wasnt what he said no sofa head board was peeling holes in sheets then we went out for a walk came back to room couldnt get in both keys wouldnt work saw hotel cleaning manager said she would get new keys came back half an hour later upon we was sat on hotel corrider floor then they wouldnt work so then had to wait another hour for lock smith to change the lock we also had a late night put do not disturb on the door but maid still tried to come in at 8.30 in the morning so woke us up anyway so no lye in we also noticed they had charged us twice for the room so had to go back yet again to reception we recieved 2 complementry drinks by this time the day had just about gone so yes fed up we was on day of checkout we was asked if we had enjoyed our stay told him edinburgh was nice but was very dissapointed with the rooms and the the over all stay and he said all rooms was the same so i said why charge more for different rooms if they are all the same he didnt seem intetested on a good note bar staff was very nice and very helpful but no would not recomend this hotel
Title: Very very dissapointed

Review: Where do i start from checking in on monday  24th august checked out wednesday 27th august giving us the total wrong room paid for superier room just gave us a normal standed room until i complained then the man on reception said sorry said he would put us in a premium room which was meant to be better than a superier room but when we got into the room it wasnt what he said no sofa head board was peeling holes in sheets then we went out for a walk came back to room couldnt get in both keys wouldnt work saw hotel cleaning manager said she would get new keys came back half an hour later upon we was sat on hotel corrider floor then they wouldnt work so then had to wait another hour for lock smith to change the lock we also had a late night put do not disturb on the door but maid still tried to come in at 8.30 in the morning so woke us up anyway so no lye in we also noticed they had charged us twice for the room so had to go back yet again to reception we recieved 2 complementry drinks by this time the day had just about gone so yes fed up we was on day of checkout we was asked if we had enjoyed our stay told him edinburgh was nice but was very dissapointed with the rooms and the the over all stay and he said all rooms was the same so i said why charge more for different rooms if they are all the same he didnt seem intetested on a good note bar staff was very nice and very helpful but no would not recomend this hotel

Review:
Check out!! Was overcharged by over £60 for breakfast which was poor service and lukewarm coffee 
We were told breakfast would be £14.50 each and were charged £28 instead each  which I didn’t see until I check my emails when home as when I asked for printed bill I was told it wasn’t possible at time so I trusted my bill would be correct which it wasn’t as there was 4 of us it was an expensive breakfast and definitely not worth it so won’t be using this hotel again

Title: Good

Review:
Cleanliness was very poor, the room has supposedly been sanitised, but it was dusty and had an unpleasant odour, as did all the corridors. The “Premier”room was very tired and in need of a revamp. They are charging 4 & 5 star prices for a 3 star room. We also went to the bar before heading out for the night. We were told to have a seat by the barman and he told us the waiter would be over to attend to us. We sat for over ten minutes before getting up and leaving. The waiter completely ignored us for the entire time. There were 4 other tables of people in, so he was hardly run off his feet. Just a very bad attitude. On the flip side the reception staff were very good.
We accept the fact that the hotel has just come out of lockdown, but surely that was a great opportunity to clean and redecorate the rooms?
We appreciate that soft furnishings have had to be removed, but the advertised minibar was completely empty for no apparent reason. And the thick dust on the back of the couches is inexcusable. Our room was not cleaned during our stay and towels and shower gel etc., were not replenished. But to be fair this maybe down to COVID-19 restrictions. I’m very aware we could have asked staff for these, but at a 4 star hotel, you really expect this to happen as a matter of course. Edinburgh is our favourite city in Scotland for a break, and we always stay in 4 & 5 star hotels there. The Radisson Blu will unfortunately be off our list in the future for places to base ourselves.

Review:
Cleanliness was very poor, the room has supposedly been sanitised, but it was dusty and had an unpleasant odour, as did all the corridors. The “Premier”room was very tired and in need of a revamp. They are charging 4 & 5 star prices for a 3 star room. We also went to the bar before heading out for the night. We were told to have a seat by the barman and he told us the waiter would be over to attend to us. We sat for over ten minutes before getting up and leaving. The waiter completely ignored us for the entire time. There were 4 other tables of people in, so he was hardly run off his feet. Just a very bad attitude. On the flip side the reception staff were very good.
We accept the fact that the hotel has just come out of lockdown, but surely that was a great opportunity to clean and redecorate the rooms?
We appreciate that soft furnishings have had to be removed, but the advertised minibar was completely empty for no apparent reason. And the thick dust on the back of the couches is inexcusable. Our room was not cleaned during our stay and towels and shower gel etc., were not replenished. But to be fair this maybe down to COVID-19 restrictions. I’m very aware we could have asked staff for these, but at a 4 star hotel, you really expect this to happen as a matter of course. Edinburgh is our favourite city in Scotland for a break, and we always stay in 4 & 5 star hotels there. The Radisson Blu will unfortunately be off our list in the future for places to base ourselves.

Review: We were staying at the Radisson Blu for one night following our wedding two days prior. We had contacted the hotel in advance, informing them of our reasons to stay, which must have been noted on our room booking as we did receive 2 complimentary drinks from the bar, which we were grateful for and enjoyed. However, the staff member at check in did not pay any attention as to why we were visiting the hotel, or even asked how we were doing when we approached him. Again, the voucher we had for a drink in the bar had "wedding" written on it, however the waitress never let on to it. There was no "Congratulations", or any personal feel from the staff we encountered during our stay, which we felt was disappointing.
Title: Our stay was good, but not outstanding.

Title: Fair

Review:
The Spa* is very deceiving from photos. This pool is tiny so please don’t book here if you actually want to be able to swim. Steam room also broke on our visit. 
I checked out and had forgotten my suit and shoes in the room. I returned a couple of hours later (same day) to collect it and was told that housekeeping couldn’t find it and so I had to fly home without it even though I knew it must of been in the building. Front of house hotel staff dealt with this matter appallingly - one member of staff even rolled her eyes and huffed and puffed at us when we said it was urgent as we had to catch a flight.
The hotel manager then stepped in and in all fairness was excellent, reassured us which was all you want as a paying customer. He said he would send me the suit when they found it (who knows how they couldn’t find it to start with being a hotel of their calibre) but anyway we left reassured we would be sent it if/ when it “showed up”.
Next day I received a call to say that they had located it and housekeeping had “put it to the side and gone home” as opposed to correctly logging it onto a system and putting it in lost property. Anyway they had my suit so that was some good news, until they tried to charge me £20-30 to post it back to me. After a stern conversation with the manager about my experience he called back to say he would send it for free. I am grateful for this but the whole thing had already ruined my stay and I won’t be returning to a Radisson group hotel again.
Such a shame as everything else was great so would have returned in the future *besides the spa point above.
Title: Good

Title: Previous guests excrement still in toilet.

Review:
No toilet brush policy hotel 😩.
Had to clean toilet myself with toilet paper.
Finally received toilet brush and was TOLD to leave it in corridor overnight as housekeeping don’t have enough.. NOT HYGENIC 😩.
If you have this policy as leave have backup for people whom want one..
Silicon over silicon around bath. Friends room had mould on silicon. Love and care needed in bathrooms..
Hotel corridor carpets old and need replacing.

Review: We didn’t like the fact that we just could not find the car park. It was a nightmare. Had to make several calls and found the whole experience stressful. It is not well signed and the sat nav code is incorrect.
Title: We enjoyed it as it’s location is excellent. Didn’t have breakfast there, it’s too expensive.

Review:
Definitely not value for money.  Very tired in areas.  Concierge on on the Friday but didn't see one all weekend.  Needed milk for the coffee machine, said done would be sent up, it wasn't. 
 First room had mould and mildew in the bathroom said we could move and that some one would be up to see us, waited half an hour no one came, went out and had a phone call saying that if we wanted to change rooms we would have to come back now which stressed the wife out.
Food in the upstairs area was good but area was cold when the door kept opening again a little tired.
We wouldn't stay again.

Review: Despite the hotel being in discussions with the council, police and local night club owner around noise issues and having received several complaints from customers in the past, the hotel still booked us into a room directly overlooking this night club. The noise levels were so bad we had to ring reception to move room at 3.00am in the morning. We went for a special occasion for my wife's birthday and it turned into a horrendous experience.
Title: Nightmare

Review: Despite the hotel being in discussions with the council, police and local night club owner around noise issues and having received several complaints from customers in the past, the hotel still booked us into a room directly overlooking this night club. The noise levels were so bad we had to ring reception to move room at 3.00am in the morning. We went for a special occasion for my wife's birthday and it turned into a horrendous experience.
Title: Nightmare

Review: Hot water was a problem, shower + bath was warm at best. Handy man advised us after 2 complaints to reception that the water heat was restricted due to health and safety. We have stayed at dozens of hotels and Radissions also and have never had hot water limited to <28 degs. The rooms also have a step up, change of level when you enter the room and also going into the bathroom for toilet, this is dangerous and easy to trip over it. Apparently all rooms have this except for the mobility, disabled rooms. Not good for Pregnant women.
Title: Lovely hotel and location, issues with hot water and steps in rooms.

Review:
Sadly there was a fire alarm at 230am which meant we had to evacuate the building.  Totally understand that these things happen but there was no explation from the staff.  Also when it came for time to check out there was no form of compensation for the fire alarm.  
Breakfast wasnt very good, food was cold which was disapointing.
Title: Great location and friendly staff.  Sadly a fire alarm put a downer on our stay.

Review:
The room is a little too small
The windows are mucky (couldn’t see the view properly.)
Title: Good

Review: The breakfast room was very busy and it felt there were rather too many guests for the size of the room although the room was lovely.  It was also quite tight packed where the buffet breakfast was, although that area wasn't too busy when I was in, at times I can image it would be very overcrowded.  The breakfast was cold, I don't think the heating trays were keeping the food hot enough and the plates were cold which didn't help to keep the heat in the breakfast.  The quality of the food in the breakfast was good however.  There was also a heavy layer of dust on the black glass tables in the bedroom, this type of glass shows dust very obviously however the room/bathroom was otherwise very clean.
Title: Was very enjoyable.

Overpriced I’m our opinion for the level of cleanliness . 3 night stay Edinburgh

Review:
I found the place a little understaffed in the cleaning department. The second floor was disappointing, but the fifth floor was great.  I didn't like one of the male back office managers tell Stefano, one of the receptionists, off in front of guests. Very unprofessional image and putting bad atmosphere into the hotel.
Also bringing luggage up was a favour as portrayed by the tone of Stefano, so that we carried our own luggage up, which does not scream 5 star. Insisting on having luggage brought down at the end of the stay took 2 phone calls to reception and one to concierge and 30 min....Concierge only there during the day. Breakfast had lots of choices but was made up of cheap options and had nothing homemade/any local specialities.
Felt like Aldi food without the organic options. No cakes.
No walk in showers. Baths need updating. No drinks were free, not even water bottles in the room...no welcome chocolate or flowers...no personalised note...no minibar....no downturn service. Big push to become a Radisson member and getting points only if not going via booking.com. Getting room service on top of prices that were about x4 also required a delivery fee! Understaffed in high traffic times (end of breakfast- time should be extended/ check out time). Kitchen and room service personnel understaffed.
A lot of cost cutting exercises, felt more 3 star than 5 star in the way it was run.
Title: Good central option for quick city break

Review:
Asked for a medium house red and got given the most expensive wine on the menu, noticed on checkout! Luckily we only had the one.
The bathroom in the room was mucky and Dusty especially the mirror and shower screen. 
Desk below bed was the same.
Kept awake till early hours due to pubs over the road and suppose to be sound proof!
On arrival not alot of information given, restaurant? Pool? Not a clue.
Upgraded to a superior room? Didn't look like it but charged for it! Always book raddison very disappointed
Title: Let down by the overall experience.

Review: Room was no different to premier inn. Only one member of staff was friendly throughout the entire stay. Extra bed had been forgotten from the booking and the upgrade to superior room was  very disappointing. Carpets were dirty, corridors dark and no fridge in room. Not what I would expect from a ‘quality’ hotel.

Review: Cleanliness, dust all around in the room, on lamp shades and tables. Have stayed radisson many times at different locations. Customer service was not up to mark as I have had good ones in past. That’s y I opted. Not a charming customer service at reception. We had a baby with us. Though parking is not guaranteed in the premises. Technology wise parking said full but there were still 3-4 spaces in the zone. When we told at the reception no extra mile was taken to have a look in the slots and help us. People at the reception need to be more charming and pleasant even though can’t be helped. But there should be a willingness to go to extra mile for customers and that was missing. Ordered milk for baby and took around 30 minutes and we have reminder twice.
Title: Overall stay was neutral, I will prefer other stays in Edinburgh. I don’t mind paying more.

Review: For an overnight city stay I would have expected to have slippers and a robe provided ... this is expected in a 4 star hotel!! Also there was no mini bar?  on arrival the bed was not made very well I thought my teenage daughter had been around ! I stayed in the RB in Istanbul and the Edinburgh version just doesn’t match up !!

Review:
Breakfast was mediocre; chewy hash browns, rubbery fried eggs, 'boiled' bacon rashers (obviously done in the oven), tepid coffee.
The bed wasn't particularly comfortable.
The restaurant facilities were quite poor for a hotel of this caliber.
Title: OK, but I'd look for somewhere else for my next visit to Edinburgh.

Review:
Requested early check in over 3 weeks earlier, arrived at 1pm, couldn’t check in until AFTER the standard 3pm. It was 3.45pm before we could check in. Pre ordered flowers, and rose petals on the bed along with chocolates- neither were there which was disappointing considering I told front desk to make sure they were there when they told me room wasn’t ready.  Not a free coffee or drink offered when it expires past the guaranteed check in time. They tried to compensate by leaving a bottle of Prosecco without asking if we drank alcohol (my partner doesn’t - and I wanted to surprise her with flowers and rose petals - not a bottle of fizzy wine). 
The room was basic, wasn’t kept the next day, and I had to request toilet rolls and towels. The bed was awful - apparently upgraded to a premium room although it was TWO single beds pushed together. not what you expect for £391 2 nights. Room 221.
Title: Okay

Review:
Staff werent very helpful.
Never told us where our room was just handed us a card and sent off. Were told our bags would be in our room when it was ready to return to our bags sitting out in the open at reception hours later.
Werent told about carpark payment or even asked if we had a car with us.
Title: Staff were not attentive. Room was beautiful and very comfortable.

Sadly disappointed with aloof staff (this does not refer to cleaners and staff in the breakfast room).

Review:
Unfortunately, the hotel had been overbooked that weekend which was not the hotel staffs' fault, but we had to stay the first night elsewhere. Initially, when they told us, they could not have been nicer: booking us to their sister hotel and offering complimentary drinks and a taxi which were great and we were not too bothered. 
However, when we got back the next day the receptionist was quite rude suggesting we had no idea what was going on and I did not know how to spell my own name which was quite insulting. The manager who we had to ask for was then lovely and knew the whole situation.  
Then we had to ask 5 times to have twin beds which was irritating, but the staff were lovely each time. They did offer us an upgrade and a free meal due to the disruption which was amazing. The meal was particularly good, but we only got drinks halfway through.
So I guess, we did overall have a nice stay, but it was a bit fawlty towers like where everything that could go wrong did. There were several members of staff who were wonderful but it was very hit and miss!
Title: Overall good, but gave fawlty towers a run for its money

Review: Not enough towels provided in room for number of guests - had to go to reception to request more. Kettle faulty, bare wires showing near plug - phoned reception who understood the issue. Staff member then brought wrong part for faulty kettle. Second visit he brought full new kettle. Toddler daughter was awaiting her milk during this time.
Title: Good location, poor overall for the £255 paid for 1 night, given the issues faced.

Review:
We had trouble finding your place.
We took a train from Edinburgh and found it very difficult to get to your place from the train station.
You should, on your web-site, mention how to get to your place if someone is carrying a couple of suitcases.
Luckily, a nice kind lady inside the Waverly station told us to take the escalators all the way up to Princes St. and walk down on North Bridge St.  towards your place.
Title: The neighborhood was a bit spooky.  Your entrance could be brighter.

Review: not very clean, staff on reception not very nice,
Title: Fair

Review:
When we got to the room there was dirty ware and glasses on the floor outside. On entering the room the sheets on the bed looked as if they had been slept on and made up badly. 
The staff gave us another room but to be honest the sheets in the newly allocated room were only marginally better. 
On one of the days, no bath towels were left in the bathroom. 
There was mould at the bottom of the bath glass. 
Whilst we stayed in the hotel there was a fire scare. We had to vacate it at around 6.30am. 
We were very surprised that not one member of staff approached us to take our names/room number or to tell us when to return. There was no apology or explanation. While I realize that the fire alert may not have been the hotels fault, I feel that the situation was handled extremely unprofessionally.
Title: Very disappointed this time

Review:
Bathrooms are not well designed. No towel rack for the hand towel, inconsistent water temperature, tub/shower combo doesn’t work well. 
Overall I was disappointed at the cleanliness of the bathroom. The extractor fan was filthy and the tub drain was blocked with filth. Not what I would expect from the Radisson.

Review:
Heating in room ineffective.
Sink plug spring not operable
Housekeeping .. Superior Room :
Very spacious but loomed barren.  room tidied up and tea tray not made up. Water not replenished.
Breakfast buffet .. Plates mostly cold for hot food,  food lukewarm to cold. Sausages and bacon undercooked. Eggs, fried and scrambled overcooked. Fresh eggs ordered from kitchen were overcooked and served on cool plate. Poor value for money .(standard rate £21.50 pp reduced to £16.50)
Noisy pubs across road till after 1:00am.
Title: Pleasant

Review: Room 623 was small for the price - the Air con didn't work properly and during our first night a sensor in the air con unit triggered an alarm that woke us up. Futhermore the room is next to a storage cupboard that was accessed quite frequently from around 7am and at several times in the day and evening, each time the user slammed the door in and out! What should have been a restful holiday was ruined for us because of this. Hotel staff friendly and helpful but this did not make up for the frequent, noisey disturbances.
Title: Average low-end 4 star hotel

Review: Unfortunately when we entered our room there was a fairly strong smell of cigarette smoke.  We attempted to ignore it initially however after having been out for a meal and after returning to our room the smell was still very evident.  After calling the reception to report this a manager came to see us.  He was very understanding and obliging and found us a different room.  It was much better and clean and bright however there was no fridge/mini bar or dressing gowns in this room.
Title: Great location and friendly staff.

Review: Unfortunately when we entered our room there was a fairly strong smell of cigarette smoke.  We attempted to ignore it initially however after having been out for a meal and after returning to our room the smell was still very evident.  After calling the reception to report this a manager came to see us.  He was very understanding and obliging and found us a different room.  It was much better and clean and bright however there was no fridge/mini bar or dressing gowns in this room.
Title: Great location and friendly staff.

Review: Reception staff left my brief case in display behind reception desk when I thought it will be stored safely for me to collect later. It was fringe and hundreds were going through the area and it was unmanned and my brief case could have easily stolen. Reception staff was so unaware of what each other were doing and passing me between concierge and reception staff. Total disgrace of hospitality tbh.

Review: Worst ever checking in experience. A male receptionist with poor command of English was extraordinarily curt and unhelpful. Extortionately expensive at over £400 per room per night. No way could that price ever be acceptable or justifiable for such an average quality hotel and one which was not nearly sufficiently staffed to cope with a very busy period during the Edinburgh Festival. The bar area at 6.30pm was a scene of utter chaos. Dreadful service for a supposed 4 Star hotel charging such enormously high prices. Would never ever return.
Title: Unforgivably Bad

Review:
Our room was clearly for a disabled person (we are not disabled but requested a walk in shower).
It would have been in many ways quite unsuitable for someone disabled.
Breakfasts were  chaotic and understaffed.
Items weren't replaced adequately and there was often quite a delay in getting hot food orders.
Title: A huge disappointment for what we had been told was a five star hotel

Title: Okay

Review: Hair dryer did not work and room had all down and feather pillows as well as feather mattress topper. Not great for allergy sufferers
Title: Good

Review:
Upon receiving an email offering an upgrade for purchase we agreed to a superior room for an extra £20 per night offering a view of Arthur’s Seat. 
Upon entering our room the  view was out of a window 2 feet square. Very small. Yes you could see Arthur’s seat but.....
The room smelled like a fire had been in the room. In the evening sitting on the bed and not touching it the bedside lamp fell off the wall. The night staff very quickly came up and fixed it
The next day when we were ready to go out and explore we went to use the safe and it didn’t work. A screw holding the outlet was just about out
There was mould on the window ledge. 
The head board which was metallic was almost worn off. 
We went and spoke with the manager Brian and he offered to go look at our room. When we got back there was a little fruit basket in the room. Safe still not fixed. Screw removed from the outlet but not fixed
No other contact from staff about the room other than a fruit basket which we received at 6pm and we were leaving the next day so not able to enjoy at all. 
This room was at most a 2-3 star room. Would not go back
Title: Not a 4 star hotel

Review: Having spilt a glass of red wine on the bed cover we were charged £350 for damages. The damages included wine stains on a table (which mostdefinitlet would wipe clean). There was no phone call to discuss any damages, just an email stating the charges. Understandably there was damage, but £350 appears extremely excessive. On attempting to call the manager who made the charges, there was no answer.
Title: Bitter.

Review:
We find duvets too hot so on cruise ships and in hotels we always ask for the duvet to be removed and a sheet a blanket put on the bed in its place.
Housekeeping just couldn’t figure it out even after they made the bed the way we asked the first day. We eventually just put out the do not disturb sign to take away the frustration.
Also every morning at 7am someone is recycling glass bottles fir half an hour in the courtyard.  We did not need a wake up call because of this.
Radisson blu did not give us points because we booked through booking.com,
Title: Good

Title: Pleasant

Review: breakfast is certainly not as good as it used to be.  this morning out pot of tea took ages to come, had to remind staff, and  was luke warm, had to ask for another.  Yesterday morning the cooked breakfast was also luke warm, also there was no smoked salmon either day.  The tablenext to ours yesterday morning had water spilled on the floor which was left.  All in all not good.
Title: Think next we plan to come to Edinburgh we will probably book somewhere different.

Review:
Aloof disinterest of reception staff on arrival.
1 mini bottle of shampoo and shower gel between 2 people. 
Miserly amount of tea bags/milk.
No bath robes. 
I realise that we only had a standard room however I think £823 for 4 nights  warrants a few extras. 
Clarity needed for room service charges.
Confusion regarding bill at checkout was upsetting and frankly spoilt our special long awaited break.
Title: Disappointing.

Review:
Took two attempts to get bedding changed from Down to non allergenic, could have been a disaster as wife very allergic to feathers. 
Breakfasts poor, cold and overcooked food which appeared to have been in trays for too long, tasteless black pudding, awful fried eggs first day too many in tray and a congealed mess in tray. Not much better second day when ordered poached eggs which eventually tuned up cold and solid. 
Dining facilities poor with not very interesting choice on menu. staff in dining area inattentive and had to be chased to get any type of service.
Title: Over priced. with less than three star service in what was surposded to be a foor star hotel.

Review:
Noisy bars next door didn’t get to sleep until 3am when they’d closed. Also bed was set up as a twin when arrived even though double was requested. 
We’ve stayed here before in a superior room and it wasn’t noisy like this one.
Title: Pay extra for a superior room away from noisy bars if staying here

Review: The buffet breakfast was terrible, probably the worst I've ever had. The staff were unfriendly and had absolutely no manners. The maitre'D (Tracy Ho) didn't appear to have please or thank you in her vocabulary. One of those who gave instructions whilst looking elsewhere rather than talking to us because she was bored of saying the same thing a 100 times. Staff were taking plates whilst one of us were still eating. The quality of food was awful. For example the bacon seemed to have just been thrown on the grill in clumps of about 8 slices so the outer 2 slices were virtually burnt with the inside slices cooked but insipid. The fried eggs were like rubber frisbees and the hash browns were inedible. I didn't try anything else as I went to look at the porridge and it was so thick it wouldn't come off the spoon so I gave up. I had tea to drink and there were 2 teabags in a large pot so no matter how long I left it and squoze the bags it was still extremely weak. I think the breakfast was £12.95 each. A total waste of money
Title: Don't bother with the breakfast

I had tea to drink and there were 2 teabags in a large pot so no matter how long I left it and squoze the bags it was still extremely weak. I think the breakfast was £12.95 each. A total waste of money
Title: Don't bother with the breakfast

Review:
Breakfast was poor - over cooked and left on hot plate. 
Queuing due to weekend rush !!

Review:
Dining room not great for breakfast. Felt cold, stark.
Everything else in the hotel was good except - when we arrived the fourth floor rooms were being cleaned and the corridors were very messy with last nights booze glasses lined you outside the doors.
In the hotel bar I ordered a medium glass of Pinot Noir wine and a pot of tea at approx 10pm. I was charged £15.50. I nearly dropped. With a tip for a nice barman it came to £17.50 for a nite-cap. And one drink was tea!

Review: Restaurant facilities
Title: Good

Review: Broken window frame at top in first room causing draft (window was also tiny), bed not king as requested (2 singles pushed together not best for couples),  rooms not dusted as mirrors very dusty near lights, bedding not changed only remade, blood on pillows, unfriendly bar staff didn't seem like they cared at all, having to call repeatedly to sort an issue on more than one occasion, charged for calls to reception to complain, broken bits falling off headboard. Appreciated room upgrade but still dirty and sofa had a lot of white stains so did not use at all. See photos. Hotel has a lot of potential and on another stay may be better but this time there was a lot to improve of which impacted our stay.
Title: Could be a lot better

Review:
The bed was very uncomfortable. It has a mattress topper on which kept moving, it also absorbed the heat from my body on a night so the bed got very hot, at one point I had to get up and I felt the bed where I was laying which was very hot to touch. 
Pillows also were poor. No filling in them so had to fold them over to get a decent pillow.
All in all a very poor sleep on both night of our stay

I did ask reception and they basically said its not something we do, sorry.

Review: The room wasn't cleaned properly. The room is full of dust that can be seen clearly with bare eyes on different areas in the room, e.g. pillows, bed sheet, towels provided and desk. It caused uncomfortable experience staying in the room. Ventilation system in the bathroom was not working so it was very stuffy during and after showerpillows and even when the door was closed for a few minutes. The lack of fresh air in the room affects some breathing difficulties when staying in the room. Wish improvements will be made and provide better service to customers.

Review: Room had not been properly serviced and used tea/coffee left out. Complained after night 1. Nothing done prior to night 2. Checked out early after night 2 but haven't heard from Hotel. I have used these Hotels in many places and arranged for others. It has always been consistent. As I haven't heard back from them, the group has just lost tens of thousands of pounds of future business. Thisxwas an excellent Hotel - as the, Scandic - many years ago. They have evidently become complacent.
Title: Enough to make me cancel tens of thousands of £ potential bookings with them. No attn to detail.

Review:
There are no tea plates available during breakfast so you have to use a dinner plate instead. No saucers either so wet teaspoons lie on the table. The bacon tastes like cardboard.
There's no air conditioning instructions.. My wife was freezing - waring 3 layers in bed (-2C outside). The next night & after many attempts to sort the problem, Reception operated it centrally. They said the Fan symbol with an "A" just blew out air but didnt change the temperature. How is anyone supposed to know that? Apparantly iit can take up to 20 minutes to reach the set temperature. We were told it wasn't the first time this has happened & they would report it to managment in the morning. Why hasn't "managment" sorted this out previously? Apart from these issues
Title: If the air conditioning is sorted out, we would recommend the hotel.

Someone entered our room at 7am
The ordered breakfasts were extremely small portions.

Review:
Noise, there's a popular bar right in front of our window, you can count on hearing the chatting & laughter till 2am.
Extremely rude reception- a mid-age woman, who checked us in.

Review:
Paid £260 for one night we went to check in and told our room wasn't ready but should be ready in an hour so we went back in an hour and told it still wasn't ready then went back again and told to wait another 20 minutes. As it was Christmas market time there wasn't anywhere to sit in whilst we waited as most places were too busy to get a seat. So we were left just walking about. I have something wrong with my stomach so this wasn't ideal at all as I was in alot of pain that day and was struggling. 
We finally got checked in and there wasn't even an apology or that for our wait. Prior to us coming I emailed asking to put balloon and that in room (paid extra) for my partners birthday and they said was ok for that to happen but didn't at all. Room was lovely but for the price we paid thought would have got treated alot better than that.
Title: Not great for price

Title: Adequate

Review:
Price - after upgrading and paying what I did I really expected a luxury stay - not so!
Room - 2 of the lights werent working (main lights) and despite 2 maid visits, no fix
View - I paid for a hill/castle view - the window was in the very far corner of the room and if I stood on one leg on my tip toes, straining my neck I could potentially have seen the top of the hill - again, after paying to upgrade, not at all what I expected.
Title: Disappointing, expensive stay.......made up for by the city and events on during the weekend

Review: The billing system created a lot of confusion. They charged me twice and their POS machine and hotel systems just didn't synch and created a lot of confusion. I had to make international calls to my bank to clarify to the hotel that the card had been charged, whilst the payment just didn't reflect on the hotels systems. They need to upgrade that as that impacts the customer experience severely.
Title: Good

Title: Good

Review: Mattress was hard and uncomfortable. Bathroom was not clean, room decore was as attractive as a 1970s office foyer, with brown and grey retro furnishing. Our room was not ready when we arrived, and we were offered an upgrade to a suite (note, not a free upgrade though) which after 36 hours travelling sounded like a good idea. It was the ugliest suite I have ever stayed in, and was expensive. Power cables across the floor, mould in the bathroom. On checking out, the gentleman at reception was impersonal and disinterested - no more money to be had, I guess.
Title: I would not stay here again.

Review: Finding a pair of knickers in the room that did not belong to my wife was not pleasant.  Also as we needed none allergenic bedding and pillows this left us with no bed topping.  Two beds pushed together were uncomfortable as you could feel the edges.  Also the doors to the rooms bang close so in a morning you can hear everyone getting up (don’t need an alarm or wake up call).  The smallest pool ever seen to match the small changing rooms.  More than two people in either and that’s them full.
Title: Excellent location but need to work on small details as rooms let this hotel down.

Review: We booked this hotel stay to celebrate a milestone wedding anniversary. When using the pool/sauna facilities, the staff were rather ignorant and unhelpful when I pointed out that there was no water available and that there were piles of empty cups left around. This made me question the cleanliness of the area as obviously no-one was checking to refill the water or clean up. Similarly in the dining area for breakfast, the staff were not particularly attentive. Our table had no milk on for our coffees and when I pointed this out to a staff member he just moodily placed one in front of me. The dining area itself is incredibly tight, with very little space between each table. I felt like we were dining with a group of other people as they were so close together! Simple things like tables spread out more and tablecloths on the tables would have made the place much nicer. I also thought the room was a let down to what was pictured prior to booking - just a plain white bedsheet hastily made, no bed runner on which I thought made the rooms look appealing in the pictures. We had told them of our anniversary prior to our stay and we did have someone come to our room with a card and gift, which was a nice gesture. However the card was just addressed to myself (not the both of us - then saying Happy Anniversary - which obviously means two people are involved) and handed us one little bag with fudge in and one drinks voucher. Gave me another fudge bag when saw 2 of us. Considering it's obviously for an anniversary it would be common sense to provide two drinks vouchers so that as a couple we could enjoy our drink together. As a manager previously, I thought this just showed little thought in the actual gesture itself as there is no point providing one gesture when the celebration is obviously for two people. Overall I thought the hotel let itself down and didn't meet my expectations, which for an anniversary celebration, is sad.
Title: Didn't meet standards - room a disappointment, moody staff and cramped dining area.

Review: A very noisy room lots of out side noise and the fire alarm going off at 12 o'clock at night. The bar area was very messy with lots of glasses everywhere felt more like a conference hotel rather than a luxury hotel. Having a drink in the bar ,staff where arranging tables all around us felt in the way so left. Its a shame as we have stayed in this hotel chain many times and think this was the untidiest. Think the conference people took over some what felt really uncomfortable .
Title: noce hotel stunning from the out side just don't stay on level 5.

Review:
After checking in at approximately 3pm, we left our room for some shopping. Upon our return it became obvious that someone had been in our room as there were some minor changes to the suite. Bedsheets had been adjusted and all of the curtains had been drawn, this wouldn’t prove to be an issue however when you know you are in possession of a number of valuables I didn’t appreciate this. 
Further to this, and more annoyingly, at approximately 12am the fire alarm began to ring out, we very quickly left the room to discover a minor state of panic amongst other guests. Of course as a health and safety procedure this wouldn’t be an issue, but what was a concern was the fact that there was no sign of any staff members in order to better organise the panic of the situation. We headed outside only to be ushered round the corner by a staff member on a cigarette break. There was no attempt to head count/ensure that everyone was evacuated and then later accounted for upon returning into the building. There was a considerate lack of communication regarding what had caused the alarm, and what the resolution had been. This is concerning given the presence of two fire engines.
The following morning we received a knock on the door to fill up the mini bar for the next guests, despite us requesting a late check out. At this point we were still getting ready for the day. 
Lastly, the light on the side of the wardrobe (above the kettle) was flickering throughout the night despite being switched off which prevented a good nights sleep.
Title: Didn’t meet expectations

Review:
After checking in at approximately 3pm, we left our room for some shopping. Upon our return it became obvious that someone had been in our room as there were some minor changes to the suite. Bedsheets had been adjusted and all of the curtains had been drawn, this wouldn’t prove to be an issue however when you know you are in possession of a number of valuables I didn’t appreciate this. 
Further to this, and more annoyingly, at approximately 12am the fire alarm began to ring out, we very quickly left the room to discover a minor state of panic amongst other guests. Of course as a health and safety procedure this wouldn’t be an issue, but what was a concern was the fact that there was no sign of any staff members in order to better organise the panic of the situation. We headed outside only to be ushered round the corner by a staff member on a cigarette break. There was no attempt to head count/ensure that everyone was evacuated and then later accounted for upon returning into the building. There was a considerate lack of communication regarding what had caused the alarm, and what the resolution had been. This is concerning given the presence of two fire engines.
The following morning we received a knock on the door to fill up the mini bar for the next guests, despite us requesting a late check out. At this point we were still getting ready for the day. 
Lastly, the light on the side of the wardrobe (above the kettle) was flickering throughout the night despite being switched off which prevented a good nights sleep.
Title: Didn’t meet expectations

Review: Radisson clearly are sweating their asset on the Royal Mile, charging a premium for a standard and dilapidated interior. When I arrived 2 out of 3 lifts not functioning, corridors unclean and it says rooms are sound proofed, main room door made of paper thin materials. I feel a bit ripped off.
Title: Pleasant

Review:
Overrated price (we had to come 2 days earlier and the price had tripled !!!.) Furthermore for this exuberant price we came into the room and the grill of air-conditioning was literally full of dust. We were afraid to launch the air-conditioning.
When we informed the staff they took immediately action.
